story:
Hi, I am Nils, the CEO of Paprcuts. When I was a kid and got my first pair of sneakers, I was so impressed by how light and at the same time super comfortable shoes can be AND how they can just rock a whole outfit! To be honest with you - people call me a shoe freak, I would call myself a sneaker lover. I always wanted to make shoes. The time has finally come now.

“The Paprcuts Sneakers is more than a shoe, it's a childhood ambition coming true.”

High-Tech Materials meet sustainability. Regional production meets global support. Plastic waste meets up-cycling. And natural fabrics replace throw away materials. Paprcuts sneakers last longer and can be recycled much better than almost any other shoe in the market. We not only want to create just another pair of shoes, but we want to create YOUR FAVORITE PAIR OF SNEAKERS.​

Our Paprcuts Sneaker will be available in two basic colours: black and white. But we wouldn’t be Paprcuts if we wouldn’t go a bit crazy - that’s why we’ve also used our favorite and best selling designs to highlight our shoes.

Materials are the key to a proper shoe. So we decided to combine the best High-Tech materials to create an innovative pair of sneakers. For further information, just scroll down!

 

Most shoes have traveled thousands of kilometres even before you’ve bought them. They get produced in developing countries under harsh circumstances. We really want to break this cycle and leave our CO2 footprint as small as possible - so in our 8 years of Paprcuts history we always go for short value chain. 

This is one reason why we decided to source all of our materials from Europe, produce in Portugal and ship from Germany. We have all the possibilities right in front of our door — support the local economy, reduce CO2 and shorten delivery routes at the same time.

Behind all these ideas is a small team of graphic lovers who never lose their drive in creating amazing accessories. We got so bored of all the dull designs out there. The world is full of individualists - everyone should express their own personality in their belongings.

You want to make the world a bit more colorful and sustainable? Follow Paprcuts. Join our journey.

The global footwear market is a multi-billion U.S. dollar industry dominated by China, India, Vietnam, and Indonesia. This Asia Pacific region accounts for over 75 percent of global shoe production. However, it's exactly these countries that are often linked to labor exploitation. Minimum wages, excessive working hours, restriction of worker's rights, and unacceptable health and safety conditions are common practices.

"Don’t get us wrong, we love big sneaker brands! We just think that we can make the process of shoe production a bit better. Producing locally and ensuring great working benefits has been crucial to our company from the very beginning.”

Hence, we began to scout for production sites within the European Union, where there are high standards in regards to labor as well as environmental restrictions. Our attention was quickly drawn to a seemingly inconspicuous small town in the Porto District in the North of Portugal.

Porto District stands out by being the heart of footwear production in all of Europe. Amongst a number of possible partners, one factory clearly stood out to us. Managed by a team of 2nd generation footwear producers with over 40 years experience in the market, our production partner not only convinced us with their dedication to their craft, but also by emphasising a welcoming and personal relationship from the very first day. This guaranteed an efficient learning process for us as we entered the shoe market for the first time. Permanent improvements and high flexibility, as well as the ongoing consideration of our wishes and requirements resulted in a unique end product.

HIGH QUALITY | HIGH PRODUCTION STANDARDS

Highest standards are ensured by our production partner to use excellent materials only. All materials are subject to strict controls and are continuously tested in specialised laboratories for quality check as well as providing distinctive solutions integrated with the environment.

Our new production partner also complimented our commitment to social responsibilities through the compliance of labour law, good practice and outstanding working conditions. Taking care for everyone involved in our supply chain is a matter close to our hearts. Amongst our numerous visits at their factory, our production partner proved themselves by having audit reports available to us at all times. We truly could not have wished for a better collaborator in this project and the high quality of our new Paprcuts Sneakers speaks for itself!

We care about the environment and so we decided to search for a solution to neutralize the CO2 that emerges during the shoe’s production. For each pair of shoes you buy, we will plant a mangrove tree in Bangladesh. Our partner Hudara will help us to realize this project, they were founded in 2015 and are very experienced. 

Mangrove trees are very efficient in absorbing CO2, they do it 1.7 times more effective compared to mixed forest. They also protect shorelines from damaging storm and hurricane winds, waves, and floods. Bangladesh is a country with extreme climate changes, they have huge temperature differences throughout the year, heavy rainfalls, floods, tornados or salinisation of the agars. Therefore, we decided to collaborate with Hudara and help them with their mangrove reforestation project in Bangladesh - producing locally while helping globally! 

Planting one tree means that we are able to compensate for the CO2 footprint of our shoe production by over two to three times! In short, by wearing our shoes you’re not only being climate neutral, but even climate positive. ​

 

Let us explain why Mangrove trees — These trees are a wonder of nature! They have a huge root system that acts as homes to different marine life. This is important for two different reasons. First, for obtaining the diversity of the species and second, for supporting the main industrial sector—fishing! Moreover, mangroves are not only a breeding place for a plethora of aquatic animals but also a natural castle for birds, monkeys and turtles. Because of this stable root system mangrove trees are protecting the land and coastlines from strong waves and floods.​

Tyvek® is the favourite material of our company. To this day, we stick with it for all of our products due to its variety of superpowers:
Tyvek® is a great alternative for all the animal lovers out there — unlike real leather, there are no animals harmed in its production. We believe that every living being should be treated with respect, thus we support animal rights and have committed ourselves to producing cruelty free products.
Tyvek® is a material as equally robust as leather. For instance, it's also used for the stabilisation of avalanche slopes. At the same time, it is light and feels just like paper. But no need to worry, in contrast to paper, Tyvek® is water repellent and will keep your feet dry at all times.
Tyvek® is produced in Luxembourg, so we only have a very little CO2 footprint in comparison to fabrics imported from far away like Asia. It is 100% recyclable, leaving endless possibilities for recreating new products while preserving our planet and its resources.

The synthetic leather we chose for our toe cap is supplied by a small factory in Italy that has dedicated itself to producing completely vegan materials. It is also approved by PETA.
The material is made out of Bio Polyols, which are elements derived from plant materials that could not be used for food farms or animal feed. It contains more than 50% of organic content coming from renewable sources.
But of course, the focus on sustainability does not end there, the facilities are fully powered by photovoltaic generators. This supports our vision to set a positive example and produce our products using environmentally friendly methods.

The increasing pollution of our oceans is a topic that can no longer be ignored. 70% of the oxygen we breathe is produced by the oceans. Therefore we must not underestimate their impact on our lives. At Paprcuts, we aim to set a positive example in mainstream fashion world by using recycled polyester for our shoe’s outside mesh. Plastic waste, such as PET bottles or abandoned fishing nets, is collected by local fishermen in the Mediterranean Sea and then is up-cycled into yarn by our supplier located in Alicante, Spain.
The final mesh is a combination of this yarn and 100% GOTS (GLOBAL ORGANIC TEXTILE STANDARD) certified organic cotton. The certification grants, fair working conditions for all people involved in the material's supply chain and ecological responsibilities, such as a low CO2 footprint, organic production systems maintaining soil fertility, and banning toxic and persistent pesticides are well taken care of.Given our focus on saving the environment, we chose a natural over petroleum-containing synthetic rubber for the sole of our shoes. Caoutchouc is a renewable resource which is cultivated and harvested sustainably. That being said, natural rubber is also biodegradable and can therefore be easily recycled. Moreover, the energy consumption for its production is only around 10% than that of synthetic rubber.
Due to its high elasticity, natural rubber adapts itself to your foot. This prevents both pressure points and pain even after long wear. Natural rubber is characterized by its outstanding durability, since the material bounces back into its original shape once the weight is lifted off. This guarantees great comfort in everyday life as well as during activities involving a lot of standing and walking such as city trips or concerts!Soft, lightweight and breathable — these are the most important factors when talking about the inner fabric of a shoe. This is why we decided to use the Coolmax® system.
Coolmax® is a fabric is known for its optimal moisture removal and exceptionally good breathability. The surface of Coolmax's fibres is up to 25% larger compared to regular polyester. Therefore, moisture is transported to the outside fast where it evaporates, allowing the fabric to dry extremely quickly.

You might be surprised to know that conventional cotton accounts for nearly 25% of the insecticides and 10% of the pesticides used throughout the world.
In contrast, organic cotton is produced without using any chemical fertilisers, pesticides or insecticides. Organic cotton is not only beneficial for the environment but is also a lot safer in regards to the health and wellbeing of the farmers and other contributors involved throughout our supply chain.

Our inside footbed is produced from cork. Cork trees are naturally found in the Mediterranean region close to our production site in Portugal.
Cork is an environmentally friendly all-rounder: It is a buoyant, elastic, and fire and water resistant material. Additionally, the focus on sustainability, recyclability and highest comfortability make cork an indispensable component for us.

 

Paprcuts is made up of 40 exceptionally talented, international team members hailing from different parts of the globe. This diversity is the groundwork of our creativity. The company was founded by Nils in 2011, when he wanted to start his own project.

Since 2012, Paprcuts has completed two crowdfunding campaigns because we believe that a crowd is always stronger than a single person. Our first crowdfunding- "The Thinnest wallet of all Times", was an amazing experience, we were trusted by over 800 backers and got 180% more funding than our fixed goal of 12,000. Aaaaand - are you still using your wallet? 

In 2017 we had a great vision of producing Paprcuts Watches. 2075 backers helped us to reach a whopping 106.271 Euro in just one month. This meant we were able to realize this project and develop a watch which actually looks like a simple wristband. Since then our watches have been one of our bestsellers — produced in the heart of Berlin. 

Our team has been growing really fast since the last two years — we have an in-house creative, marketing, support team and our own production facility in Berlin. The most important thing we have is a team that believes in the same values. We believe in producing regionally with higher standards - creating colorful and practical things. We never stand still and are always thinking of taking a new step towards a conscious lifestyle.

story:
After a year of hard work, it's finally time to officially launch Pulchritude Boutique! We can only do this with your help!! 


WHO I AM:

I am Ericka Symonette and I am originally from Cincinnati, Ohio. I have been married to Joshua for 9 years and we are the parents of Jaylah (8) and Joslyn (5). I am entering my 10th year as a teacher and I currently teach high school fashion marketing. I am a graduate of Howard University. 

 
WHAT PULCHRITUDE IS ABOUT:

OUR NAME: Means "extraordinary physical beauty; loveliness", usually used in reference to a shapely woman

OUR MISSION: To promote positive self-image within the global community

OUR CORE VALUES: People, Integrity, Creativity, Diversity, and Social Responsibility


WHAT I AM DOING:

Although I love fashion, shopping, and all things glamourous and wonderful, it is important to me that my business serves a greater purpose. I am passionate about helping others, in particularly women. I am going to use Pulchritude as a vehicle to promote and encourage positive self-image within the global community. This goal is at the heart of what Pulchritude is about.

 

WHY HUMAN TRAFFICKING:

As a mother of two daughters and a high school teacher who works with young people everyday, I was stunned to discover that more than a million kids and young women are trafficked every year. This is a SERIOUS problem. I learned of various organizations who rescue victims, but knew little of what kind of support is provided once these individuals are set free. What Pulchritude will do is provide support and resources for rescued victims ranging from counseling, school supplies, hygiene products, clothing, housing, and food.

 

HOW YOUR DONATION HELPS:

MERCHANDISE: Since we will be solely online initially, our biggest expense will be acquiring great merchandise for our customers. Our plan is to start off with a select number of pieces and then add additional merchandise as we grow.

 

SHIPPING SUPPLIES: Next, your donation will help us obtain shipping supplies and set up a business account with our delivery service provider. Shipping supplies include boxes, personalized shipping tape, tissue paper, and merchandise tags.

 

TECHNOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT: Your donation will also allow us to purchase technology that will help us operate more efficiently such as an iMac computer and an iPad. When you have an online store, it is nice to have the ability to take your store whenever you go!

 

WEB HOSTING: Finally, your donation to our Kickstarter project will help us launch the website in October. We will be using Shopify to set up our store. Your donation will help start the Shopify account and fund the photo shoot that will take place in order to get images of our merchandise. Photo shoot costs include studio, make-up artist, photographer, and hair stylist for 4-5 models.

We recognize that everyone is not in a position to give financially. No problem! If you can't give a donation at this time, you can always help us out by spreading the word about our fundraising campaign!

Thank you so much for your support! Team Pulchritude is truly grateful!!!

story:
My name is Nic Tharpa Cartier. I have been henna artist, jewelry maker, and clothing and textile designer for many years. It is my goal in life to be able to support myself and make a living doing this exciting creative work. 

Recently, through a series of lucky coincidences, I was able to visit Marrakech, Morocco, somewhere I had dreamed of going for some time. It was a trip that would change my life forever.

On my trip, I taught several Moroccan women the art of henna. For women in Morocco, jobs are hard to find, and henna is one traditionally respected job for a woman to have. After taking my classes which were offered for free, my students expressed moving and heartfelt gratitude for the opportunity to learn this skill that they can use to provide for their families. Then and there I vowed that I would return to Morocco so that I could continue this work.

But, traveling to Morocco is not cheap, and in order to return to Marrakech to work with my students, I need to come up with a source of funding. Luckily, I realized that I could use my own artistic passion to give myself the means to continue this amazing project. I had found a place where I could pursue my dreams as an artist, and I could help people in the process. 

Here's how it works: My goal with this fundraiser is to raise seed money that I can use to launch a line of jewelry, all made in good working conditions for a living wage by local Moroccan craftspeople. Profits from the sales of those items will create the funding I need to continue running henna classes. I want to be able to run these classes for many years into the future, so creating this small business will provide an ongoing source of funding. 

Additionally, I'll be working with local artists and craftspeople on the execution of designs for my company, which will help keep the community of traditional artisans thriving. 

What We Need & What You Get

To pursue this project, I need a few different things. First, I need to travel to Marrakech and spend some real time there. This part includes basics like airfare, lodging, and food.

Next, I need seed money to cover the expenses involved in launching my project. This will cover supplies and labor. All supplies will be sourced in Marrakech through small local businesses. I will need to work with local jewelers, leather workers, and supply shops.

It is important to me to speak face to face with the people who will help me with this work, and to ensure that I am paying them fairly for their services. Supporting independent craftspeople is another important way that I hope to give something back to the city that gives me so much inspiration.

I will also need to provide supplies for my henna students. I want to be able to set each student up with whatever she needs to learn quickly and efficiently so that she can be working in her new field as soon as she is ready. Henna supplies can for the most part be found locally in Marrakech, and the money used to purchase them goes back into the local economy. Over time, as the fashion company begins to make money, those profits will be put back into my teaching efforts. 

Finally, I need to cover the fees involved in establishing sales outlets for my products, such as through an Etsy store, dedicated website, and other online retailers, and for shipping and insurance of my products to boutiques. The more successful my venture is, the more often I will be able to return to Marrakech to continue working with my henna students there. 

What do you get? Great perks!

Marrakech, the city that allowed this opportunity to come into being, is a riot for the senses. Nothing in Marrakech is ordinary, even down to a simple postcard, and the magic of this ancient city is a true inspiration. 

Along with my sincere thanks, you can choose your donation level and receive a little thank you gift in return, something just for you from this magical place. Choose a postcard, a henna art print, a charm, a selection of traditional beauty products, or even a piece of custom jewelry. 

Why jewelry?

I could have just asked for donations to cover the cost of teaching these classes, but in that situation, when the money's gone, it's gone. By starting a business which will continue to earn revenue, I have a way to take the seed money I gather here, and grow it into a project that becomes self sustaining over time. Profits from the jewelry company will directly fund my teaching activities, and as long as that business remains successful, I will be able to continue running classes. 

Jewelry has been a passion of mine for years, and with this project I get to bring my ideas to life. It's an amazing creative outlet for me, and one that brings benefit to countless others through the classes it supports.

The Impact

Allow me to relate the story of one of my students, a Moroccan woman named Fatiha. She excelled at henna and was really a natural, and we spent the better part of a day practicing and drawing designs.

Later on, a mutual friend related to me what Fatiha had told her: Fatiha told her that nobody had ever been so nice to her, and she was so happy to have this new skill that she can use to make a living for her family. She had also had her entire outfit made just for the occasion, as if she was going to a wedding, because she said she had never been so honored in her life as to be invited to the henna class. When I heard that, I think my heart broke open, and I knew that I had found my mission. I have to go back so that I can keep doing this work!

My first experiences in Morocco were the most humbling, awe inspiring, and uplifting I have ever had. To see that I could make a difference in people's lives through my art was extremely powerful, and gave my whole existence as an artist a greater meaning that I could not have created alone. I have always believed that art can change lives, but now I am certain, and I have seen just how much good it can do. By setting up my project, I will be able to continue traveling to Morocco and helping the local women find work, earn income, and feed their families.

Now all I need is your help to get me back to Morocco so I can continue what I started. Thanks so much for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help get the word out by telling friends, family, neighbors, and anyone you know who values art and adornment that gives back! Your help publicizing this campaign is invaluable!

By taking a minute to share this on your facebook, twitter, tumblr, or pinterest, you are doing me a great favor and helping me reach more people than I could possibly reach alone. I can't do it without you! Thank you!
story_txt:
My name is Nic Tharpa Cartier. I have been henna artist, jewelry maker, and clothing and textile designer for many years. It is my goal in life to be able to support myself and make a living doing this exciting creative work. 
Recently, through a series of lucky coincidences, I was able to visit Marrakech, Morocco, somewhere I had dreamed of going for some time. It was a trip that would change my life forever.
On my trip, I taught several Moroccan women the art of henna. For women in Morocco, jobs are hard to find, and henna is one traditionally respected job for a woman to have. After taking my classes which were offered for free, my students expressed moving and heartfelt gratitude for the opportunity to learn this skill that they can use to provide for their families. Then and there I vowed that I would return to Morocco so that I could continue this work.
But, traveling to Morocco is not cheap, and in order to return to Marrakech to work with my students, I need to come up with a source of funding. Luckily, I realized that I could use my own artistic passion to give myself the means to continue this amazing project. I had found a place where I could pursue my dreams as an artist, and I could help people in the process. 
Here's how it works: My goal with this fundraiser is to raise seed money that I can use to launch a line of jewelry, all made in good working conditions for a living wage by local Moroccan craftspeople. Profits from the sales of those items will create the funding I need to continue running henna classes. I want to be able to run these classes for many years into the future, so creating this small business will provide an ongoing source of funding. 
Additionally, I'll be working with local artists and craftspeople on the execution of designs for my company, which will help keep the community of traditional artisans thriving. 
What We Need & What You Get
To pursue this project, I need a few different things. First, I need to travel to Marrakech and spend some real time there. This part includes basics like airfare, lodging, and food.
Next, I need seed money to cover the expenses involved in launching my project. This will cover supplies and labor. All supplies will be sourced in Marrakech through small local businesses. I will need to work with local jewelers, leather workers, and supply shops.
It is important to me to speak face to face with the people who will help me with this work, and to ensure that I am paying them fairly for their services. Supporting independent craftspeople is another important way that I hope to give something back to the city that gives me so much inspiration.
I will also need to provide supplies for my henna students. I want to be able to set each student up with whatever she needs to learn quickly and efficiently so that she can be working in her new field as soon as she is ready. Henna supplies can for the most part be found locally in Marrakech, and the money used to purchase them goes back into the local economy. Over time, as the fashion company begins to make money, those profits will be put back into my teaching efforts. 
Finally, I need to cover the fees involved in establishing sales outlets for my products, such as through an Etsy store, dedicated website, and other online retailers, and for shipping and insurance of my products to boutiques. The more successful my venture is, the more often I will be able to return to Marrakech to continue working with my henna students there. 
What do you get? Great perks!
Marrakech, the city that allowed this opportunity to come into being, is a riot for the senses. Nothing in Marrakech is ordinary, even down to a simple postcard, and the magic of this ancient city is a true inspiration. 
Along with my sincere thanks, you can choose your donation level and receive a little thank you gift in return, something just for you from this magical place. Choose a postcard, a henna art print, a charm, a selection of traditional beauty products, or even a piece of custom jewelry. 
Why jewelry?
I could have just asked for donations to cover the cost of teaching these classes, but in that situation, when the money's gone, it's gone. By starting a business which will continue to earn revenue, I have a way to take the seed money I gather here, and grow it into a project that becomes self sustaining over time. Profits from the jewelry company will directly fund my teaching activities, and as long as that business remains successful, I will be able to continue running classes. 
Jewelry has been a passion of mine for years, and with this project I get to bring my ideas to life. It's an amazing creative outlet for me, and one that brings benefit to countless others through the classes it supports.
The Impact
Allow me to relate the story of one of my students, a Moroccan woman named Fatiha. She excelled at henna and was really a natural, and we spent the better part of a day practicing and drawing designs.
Later on, a mutual friend related to me what Fatiha had told her: Fatiha told her that nobody had ever been so nice to her, and she was so happy to have this new skill that she can use to make a living for her family. She had also had her entire outfit made just for the occasion, as if she was going to a wedding, because she said she had never been so honored in her life as to be invited to the henna class. When I heard that, I think my heart broke open, and I knew that I had found my mission. I have to go back so that I can keep doing this work!
My first experiences in Morocco were the most humbling, awe inspiring, and uplifting I have ever had. To see that I could make a difference in people's lives through my art was extremely powerful, and gave my whole existence as an artist a greater meaning that I could not have created alone. I have always believed that art can change lives, but now I am certain, and I have seen just how much good it can do. By setting up my project, I will be able to continue traveling to Morocco and helping the local women find work, earn income, and feed their families.
Now all I need is your help to get me back to Morocco so I can continue what I started. Thanks so much for your support!
Other Ways You Can Help
Help get the word out by telling friends, family, neighbors, and anyone you know who values art and adornment that gives back! Your help publicizing this campaign is invaluable!
By taking a minute to share this on your facebook, twitter, tumblr, or pinterest, you are doing me a great favor and helping me reach more people than I could possibly reach alone. I can't do it without you! Thank you!

story:
PRE-ORDERS ARE SHIPPING.

Thank you!

Our Indiegogo Campaign is over.

We are currently shipping pre-orders. We are gunning to get all existing pre-orders shipped by mid to end of February. 

In February our new web site will go live. You can see a preview of it by clicking on the link below. It is still under some refinement and will keep on evolving, but it is close.

http://www.yeswatch.com

 

 

 

The very first order of 3 EQ's shipped to Jan in London.

He and another dear friend Lars are quite the wine connoisseurs. You can’t go wrong drinking with these guys. I remember many, many moons ago the three of us sharing some bottles well into a warm summer night in the South of France. Jan offered to put in the first $50K to get the programming started for what eventually became the Equilibrium. Without their bravery we would not be here today. Forever grateful.

The Fab Four:

Jan, Gunnar, Bjørn and Lars at http://www.solsiden.no in Oslo, Norway.

We are very excited to finally bring the EQ to your wrist. The first production batch of EQ’s that we received last week is testing flawlessly, that has gotta count for something. Thanks for your endless patience.

 

Phil Baker has been wearing the Equilibrium for a week. He has been developing and reviewing scores of products for 40 years. Click on this link to see what he had to say: https://pjmedia.com/lifestyle/2017/08/26/a-unique-electronic-watch-thats-not-from-apple/#comments

 

     “It all started out while traveling the Caribbean decades ago. I simply wanted to know when the sun would rise the next morning. Go for a beach walk at the first rays. My gleamingly beautiful Rolex Submariner was of no use at all. So I decided to make my own watch.”

           Bjorn Kartomten
           Founder, YES watch

 


Epic Time Keeping on your Wrist.
 

No other watch on the planet offers the functionality and wealth of time information that the new 24-hour Equilibrium collection from YES watch does. There is no comparison. This is the most unique time piece ever.

Many moons ago we decided to grab hold of the true essences of time and make that the foundation of the extraordinarily unique 24-hour watches our team has gone on to produce since 1999. It was not an exercise in design for the sake of design; it was an exercise in design for the most comprehensive presentation of time ever offered on your wrist. It was a calling.

At a glance the EQ will give your hours, minutes and seconds as well as times for sunrise, sunset and twilight, moonrise, moonset and moon phase plus alert you to solstices, equinoxes and cross quarter days for exactly where you are. It also has a range of alarms, an electronic compass along with a host of other time data information and features.

The unique design has one 24-hour hand and a 24-hour dial to which the multiple circular dials sync up with.

 

These are the Equilibrium hardware specifications:

48x17mm titanium case with sapphire crystal in silver-tone or IP black with water-resistance to 10 ATM .

-3 or 5 link titanium bracelets with locking clasp.
-Choice of silicon, leather and NATO straps.
-Choice of 5 rotating bezels in 3 different colors with mirror backed orange/yellow sun/moon stones.
-High resolution near white positive TDF LCD. Black negative non TDF LCD by request. TDF means Transflective Display Film which greatly increases perceived contrast in LCD. In a negative LCD however, TDF has an adverse effect.
-Inner 24-hour dial with 24 tritium T100 tubes, plus one tube on the analog hand, and a bright luminescent backlight. Together they provide a gorgeous nighttime viewing experience. See this link for more info on what T100 means: http://tritiumreview.blogspot.com/2012/06/tritium-watches_8697.html
-The master quartz crystal is attached to the PCB and controls all the timings. This master is connected directly to CPU.  The timing and the accuracy of the Ronda analog drive are also driven from this CPU. The computer controlled analog hand and the digital time is automatically synchronized.
-Custom made lithium ion polymer rechargeable battery with 2-3 months of battery life on a full night charge. Expected battery life is 5 years.
-Comes in a strong custom presentation box with room for additional straps, jeweler’s tools, recharge clip with USB wire and Instruction Manual.
-Two year limited warranty.

Even though it looks like it, these pictures were not taken in a submarine, but in a bar late at night. Regardless of circumstances the tritium tubes and backlight will make nighttime reading crystal clear.

Following the Sun and the Moon.

Once you study time keeping beyond the springs and screws and luxury bragging rights they have made you think it is all about, you will find a millennia long timeline of fascinating evolution, understanding and history. Calendars and time keeping were spawned by the heavens above, by the sun and the moon, everything else followed. It is in this realm of wisdom and awareness that the Equilibrium finds its platform and ancestry. What a fashionista might be hawking as trending today is kinda completely irrelevant. Time is timeless.

-This is the man-made time data the Equilibrium keeps track of.
-Hours, minutes and seconds in AM/PM or 2400 format
-City name. 587 cities worldwide have been pre-programmed into the watch. It can also be set by LAT/LON, TZ and DST
-Year, date, month and day
-LAT/LON
-TZ and DST   
-DOY & WEEK #

Any quartz movement has an accuracy of about plus/minus 20 seconds a month. It comes with the territory. In the EQ software program we have added a +/- 60 seconds accuracy adjustment capability of the quartz oscillator. Once you have determined the variation in your watch you can trim the EQ to an accuracy of plus/minus 1 second a month. 

 

The Circles of Time in the Equilibrium.

Time isn’t linear and it isn’t just a number. Time is spatial and it is alive. The stunningly detailed LCD in the EQ takes a hold of this universal knowledge and creates a display of circular dials that will relate your space and time to the rotation of the earth and to the cycles of the sun and the moon.

The black 24-hour circle of time.
This is by far the most essential time in society today. Everything runs according to it. Jet planes, shops, rock concerts, what have you, it all relates back to this time. When something begins and when it ends, when to meet, when to leave. In 1883 the powers that be divided the world into 24 time zones, on average 15 degrees each, even though over land the TZ border follows geographical specifics and can vary greatly. All time calculations in the Equilibrium are based on UTC time.

In the EQ the 24-hour dial has a tritium tube for every hour and markers at quarter and half hours.

The orange sun circle.
Next to the 24-hour dial the orange sun circle gives you the time data for the sun. Sunrise and sunset, times for morning and evening twilight, solar high noon or zenith, and finally solar midnight. The dark area gives you nighttime, the checkered part gives you twilight and the light orange part indicates daytime.

The yellow moon circle.
The inner yellow circle will give you time for moonrise and moonset and lunar high noon or midnight. When the moon is up and when it is down. This circle can also be used to display SR/SS for an alternate location.
The moon phase display is accompanied by waxing /waning arrows.

The AM/PM circle.
Just outside the 24-dial, on the titanium collar that holds the crystal in place there is a shiny/satin finish on the two halves indicating AM/PM from 0000-1200

The outer circle, the rotating bezel.
Offered in five different bezel insert designs in three different colors. You choose which one makes the most sense for you.

At the push of a button the following time data will read out in the dot-matrix. It is accurate to plus/minus 2 minutes:

-Times for sunrise/zenith/sunset/civil twilight/nautical twilight/astronomical twilight
-Times for moonrise/lunar noon/moonset/% luminance/date and time of next new moon/time and date of full moon

Alerting you to solstices, equinoxes and cross-quarter days.

On the 8 main turning points of the sun the inner yellow dial will alert you to the event.  The inner yellow circle will display a gradual checkered pattern as the year progresses. At the top of the hour the event name as well as exact time for it is displayed.

The EQ pictured above and below has been fitted with the solunar bezel, which creates the cleanest design. If less is more, this is the one for you, but any of the 5 bezels in black, orange or yellow metallic will look great. The bezel, as well as the strap colors, are yours to pick, tell us which one you want.

 


"If you're like me and want the ultimate watch that would do absolutely everything except perhaps tell time on Mars, then the YES Equilibrium is the watch for you. I've been beta-testing this watch for the past 3 or 4 months and have fallen in love with both its functionality and its design. I never had a watch that generated so much interest. When people see it and hear my words of praise, they ask where they can get one! Of course, a watch with so many features requires investing a small amount of start-up time to figure out how to really use the features. But that's a small cost in exchange for so much benefit.

The beta version had a few problems with power consumption, along with some minor design flaws here and there. But these have now been attended to and the final, commercial version of the watch should be available in a few weeks. I can hardly wait!"

     John Casti, Vienna, Austria
 

Click on this link to see a video of how you Change the Cities in the Equilibrium:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d6jqE2A61YY&t=6s
 
 

Please note that the watch pictured above will have a yellow and black bezel in the final version.

The ultimate time partner that handle battlefields as well as boardrooms.

I think of this as the workhorse in our EQ collection. The subtle wear-resistant satin finish case fitted with a sturdy 5-link Jubilee bracelet in lightweight titanium and a sapphire crystal can’t be beat. No matter how rough and tumble your life style is my guess is that you are going to need sleep way before this watch will quit on you.

Pilots, astronomers, travelers, military personnel, outdoors men, boaters, healers, scientists, bon vivants and watch collectors alike will all find the EQ of great intelligence offering coordination no ordinary watch can ever match. There is no end to what tasks or events customers have told us their YES watch has helped them approach with calm, confidence and success. The EQ takes time keeping to the next level, it takes guessing out of time.

Check out this link for some stories from our past:
http://www.yeswatch.com/wrist-watch/timekeeper/press-news.html
 


 

Twilight, this most magical time of the day, has been included in the EQ. At a glance the checkered pattern in the outer orange sun circle will give you the combined duration of all three of them. By pushing a button you can get the exact range for civil, nautical and astronomical twilight to the minute.

Click on this link to see video of the Time Review feature in the Equilibrium:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pe_uJ2npgy8

 

The black beauty.

There is something about black that is always beautiful. Like that little black dress that all women have in their closet. Who knows what the attraction truly is, but here it is on the Equilibrium. 10 micron deep black IP plating, polished to a high gloss on the case coupled with the classic Presidents bracelet.

There isn’t a single calendar in the history of humanity that hasn’t attached itself to the sun. During each year we cycle through its 8 main turning points: 2 equinoxes when the days and nights are identical in duration, 2 solstices where the sun is either at it highest or lowest in the sky and 4 cross quarter dates halfway between each of them. As you study calendars you will find that cultures worldwide have repeatedly linked faith-based celebrations around these events. The EQ alerts you to every one of them. At the top of the hour the dot matrix will spell out its name and time of passing for exactly where you are to the minute. No other watch on the planet does this.

 

 

Click on this link to see a video of the different Modes of the EQ:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zzEmzKrZ6Ow
 

The choice of professionals.

If sometimes you need stealth, unobtrusive power or just must to be in the know, then this is the watch for you. The tough black all satin case finish with a near scratch proof sapphire crystal will faithfully stand by your timing task at hand.

Any quartz movement have an accuracy of about plus/minus 20 seconds a month, it comes with the territory. You think the 32768 vibrations per second would guarantee accuracy but by time the oscillator has been manufactured you got variations. In the EQ software program we have added a +/- 60 seconds accuracy adjustment capability of the quartz oscillator. Once you have determined the variation in your watch you can set the EQ to compensate for it to the second. A very nifty feature, the IM will tell you how.

 

 

Click on this link to see the different Alarms in the EQ:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_39lGon_lM

 

Mind over Matter.

In a mindful and beautiful design that focuses on content, application and wear, while throwing fads and frills to the side, the Equilibrium is for those who are ready to graduate from the ordinary to the special. This is the one that carefully and accurately reconnects man-made and natural circadian rhythms. This is for the part of your soul that nurtures a free and independent thought. This is your time.

Alarms, stopwatch, 7 languages and a compass.

Watches are always in one form or another about timing. To that end we have added a range of alarm options to the Equilibrium. The alarm sound may not wake you from a deep sleep but it certainly is loud enough when you are waiting for a sign. Here they are:
~Daily Alarm. This is your regular set alarm with a 10-minute snooze.
~99 minute timer.
~Sunrise/set alarm. Chimes at event time with pre-alarm time of 0-60 minutes as set by user.
~Cuckoo alarm. Like Grandpas old clock, chimes at the top of the hour with 00 -24 hour range set by user.
~999 day countdown/up with user set event date.
~Regatta Alarm. The official countdown sequence used in official regattas. Automatically converts to stopwatch when start is successful.

All the alarms relate to whichever location your watch is set for.

The Equilibrium also has a stopwatch with lap times that counts to 1/100 of a second. Lap times kept in memory for review until the stopwatch is reset.

The 7 languages for menu settings and readouts are: English, Spanish, German, French, Norwegian, Italian and Portuguese.

The spot on accurate electronic compass has N/S/E/W arrows and a digital readout of degrees. The analog hand will stay fixed at 1200 which will align to 00 N readout. 

The practical applications and insights of
the EQ are endless.

There is no end to the uses and tasks customers have told us their Yes watches have enabled them to manage better and with greater accuracy. The Equilibrium is a superior tool for confident timing. It is also a great conversation starter.

World travelers. Instantly ground yourself to local time. Carefully used it can effectively help you overcome jet lag. Once you set your location the hand and LCD display sets itself automatically compensating for TZ and DST.

Astronomers. With the added feature of twilight, your best time to view the universe just became even more accurate to predict.

Photographers. Professionals can plan for the best natural light conditions and when to shoot throughout the day and night. You can plan to shoot at the golden hour, to up your Instagram game!

Military. Operations are critically planned around the availability of light, or the lack thereof. They got bin Laden on a moonless night, it was not a coincidence. The 2400 time display makes it a natural for the Special Forces.

Pilots. Flying changes dramatically after dark, like night and day. All of a sudden you see nothing, except maybe artificial lights and the horizon disappears. If JFK junior had an EQ he might have been the President today.

Boating. The same goes for boating. The last thing you want to run into is a rock or a log after dark. Much better to be in harbor or anchored before the sun is setting.

Motor biking. Driving changes drastically after dark. In an unfamiliar spot especially, you might be best off planning to be back at the hotel before the sun goes down.

Outdoorsmen. Not much brings you closer to nature than camping, fishing and hunting. With the EQ you can predict the rhythm of day and night exactly. Plan the activities with complete confidence.

Watch collectors. If you are a watch enthusiast your collection is not complete until you have one of these unique timepieces. You can only have so many watches giving you hours, minutes and seconds before they are all just the same.

Moments of sanctuary. A quiet time, a prayer or a kindred ritual aligned with the divine rhythms of the sun and the moon makes the experience just so much richer and stronger. Try it sometime.

 

Insights of great timing for those

who travel light.

 

For the world traveler there isn’t a better wristwatch out there. Not only does the EQ give you time for 600 cities worldwide adjusted for TZ and DST, but it also instantly grounds you to the local rhythm of day and night and your place in it. With this unique insight you can help overcome jet lag quicker and plan your activities to safely do things before and after dark sets in.

If you are way out there the EQ can also be set by your actual LAT/LON giving you sun and moon time data to an accuracy of plus minus 2 minutes.

 

Click on this link to see a video of how the Compass in the EQ works:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=njJ0uiLan-Q
 

Your bezel­ choice.

The rotating bezel offers the ability to keep track of an additional universe of time keeping at a glance. It has been around for a long time, most prominently used on dive watches. Knowing how long you could stay submerged were of critical importance, nobody wanted the bends.

With the unique day and night perspective in our watches we have designed 5 bezels that each offers a different function. You choose yours. With your Indiegogo pre-order send me an e-mail at bj@yeswatch.com to indicate which one you want, please include IG order number.

The bezels will also be offered for sale individually as replacement or exchange for $39 each.

The bezels are omni-directional to allow for maximum accuracy in adjustment. We have paid extra attention to getting a firm friction on the bezel to keep it stay in one place once set.

The bezel inserts are held in place by strong double stick tape. The IM will tell you how to exchange them. The bezel insert you tear out will most likely not be usable again, but it is a great way to refresh your watch when the time comes.

 

Your titanium bracelet choice.

There is no stronger and arguably no more beautiful metal bracelet than the classic 3-link President design. The 5-link follows a close second. The high gloss shiny EQ case gets the 3-link bracelet, the more subdued satin case get the 5-link. That goes for both silver-tone and black versions. The bracelet lug nuts are 22mm and will fit any standard bracelet. The bracelet is attached with heavy-duty spring pins.

When pre-ordering an EQ with metal bracelet, please send e-mail to bj@yeswatch.com with your preference. Replacement bracelets will be available for sale on our web site.

 

Your leather, NATO and silicon strap choices.

We found a cool black leather strap with a checkered pattern that plays well with our watch and bezel design. For a tan strap the classic plain one is the one that counts. All the buckles will have the logo engraved.

 

There are a gazillion NATO straps out there. We are starting with these three. The orange will light up just about any room.

 

The  silicone straps offers a comfortable and solid wear if rough and tumble is part of your daily life.

 

When you buy a watch with the titanium bracelet you get one of each, with your choice of color. Let me know which colors when you pre-order.

If you go for the $590 pre-order pick the one strap you want, let me know at bj@yeswatch.com and we’ll fit it on for you.

All the straps will be for sale individually on our web site.

 

Packaging custom built for secure worldwide shipping.

The Equilibrium watch is held firmly in place in a velvet cradle and will be wrapped in a sheet of protective vinyl. Next to it is a small compartment with a padded lid that will stay firmly closed even if the package does a couple of somersaults on its way to you. Inside is room for the recharge clip and wire, the jeweler’s tools, the bezel oil and other knickknacks needed to keep your new watch humming. The lid has a drawing with buttons and basic watch functions called out. Behind the ledge that holds the instruction manual in place are two elastic pockets for spare straps and bracelets. A solid hinge with firm resistance will keep the strong, lightweight plastic box shut tight even if it happens to roll around in the back seat of your car. Very nice, very sturdy, very practical.

 

We will set the watch before shipping.


The astronomical algorithms of the sun and the moon are complex. The Equilibrium has a wealth of time keeping data and it is the kind of watch were you want to read the Instruction Manual to get full use of it. You will find the operations to be quite intuitive, but for starters you are going to want to spend some time with it to familiarize yourself.

Smart watches and phones only last a day or two; with the EQ you can go on a long vacation and not have to worry about the battery. The battery lasts for at least 30 days, and that is far better than most rechargeable watches on the market. 

 

Recharging the EQ battery.

The perpeteum mobile has yet to be invented even though we keep on trying. The EQ has a hardcore lithium recharge battery set-up. We custom built the battery for maximum size, thinness and longevity. Simply clip the charger on to your watch, make sure the contact are clean and engage, the clip light will turn to red when it happens and leave it in overnight. It will be green in the morning. It connects via a regular USB contact to your computer or battery adapter.

The critical part about a rechargeable battery is to never let it go flat and sit like that for any length of time. It will forever diminish its ability to hold a charge. Charging it before it goes really low is the best policy. Nothing lasts forever, after an estimated 5 years you will have to replace the battery.

 

Watches and water will always be at odds.

Decades ago the term water-proof was used, but since nothing truly is, take anything deep enough and it will leak, the industry changed the term to water resistance back in the 70’s. This is measured in ATM.  The EQ is constructed to 10 ATM. This means it can be taken down to 100 meters depth without leaking.  It also means, and many watch buyers don’t know this, that the crown or buttons cannot be operated while submerged or in contact. If you do you will momentarily breach the double o-ring seal and the outside water pressure will turn your watch into an aquarium quicker than you can say it. Now you know.

I have been ocean swimming with the EQ for weeks now and I am confident that with normal use the internal cavity will stay perfectly dry. 

 

Reconnecting the cycles of the sun and the moon with hours, minutes and seconds.

I guess you can say it all started on a beach in St. Barts back in the mid 90’s. I simply wanted to know when the sun would rise the next morning. To catch the first rays on a quiet beach walk. My gleamingly beautiful Rolex Submariner was of absolutely no use at all.

I checked around and quickly learned that the daily passing of the sun, the most fundamental timekeeper of all, had never ever been captured in a wristwatch. How come it had been ignored? I quickly learned why. Only through incredibly complex astronomical algorithms based on latitude and longitude could the sun’s path and timing be predicted accurately. I decided to make my own.

At first I wanted the watch to be a mechanical masterpiece. At the 1997 Basel  fair I arranged a meeting with an engineer with the renowned German watchmaker Glashutte. After speaking for a few minutes he just smiled and cut me off. He said that if I wanted to capture all that time data in a mechanical movement, I would be carrying a backpack. We laughed and had another beer.

It proved that only with digital chip technology was it possible to capture the nuanced cycles of the sun and the moon on your wrist. A curious dichotomy and blessing inextricably entwined.

In 2002 the Worldwatch II was updated to include times for moonrise and moonset. 

Big strikes back.

In 1999 we incorporated the YES watch company in Marin County, California and got to work with our Swiss and Hong Kong partners. Creating perfection was and is a whole lot easier said than done, but 18 months later we proudly released our first collection, the WorldWatch.

It was a rude awakening. In spite of being a very lean and mean time machine, the case measured in at a solid 43x16mm. The size prompted a nearly wholesale rejection in the market place. It turned out that the watch industry was not in the time keeping business, they were in the jewelry business. Time keeping ability seemed almost irrelevant.

 

Professionals picked up on the time keeping insights offered.

Those who had a practical application for the time data offered, soon emerged. Astronomers gave us our first love. Photographers, cinematographers, pilots, boaters, world travelers, military personnel and watch collectors soon followed suit. With the YES watch they could all plan their activities with much greater accuracy and confidence than ever before.

In 2004 we sent a sample of the Zulu watch to the Chief Astronomer with the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, London. His scientific and historical review was stellar and I was beyond flattered when he immediately put the watch on display, in the Museum collection. That is when I knew my instincts were legit.    

   

The titanium with sapphire crystal  48x16mm collection: Zulu, Kundalini and Inca.

 

 

The Tati and Luna collections have an all digital module and fits snugly to a smaller wrist. 

Check out this link for an interview that tells more of the story:
http://www.yeswatch.com/wrist-watch/timekeeper/press-bjorn-kartomten.html

Over the years we have gotten the kindest reviews, promotions and watch sales from all over the planet. The logos above represent many of those who helped us, we are most grateful to you all. As we are to all our dear customers who have shown us loyalty and love. Thank you!

 

 Listening intently.

There is no better product feed back than what you get from caring customers, from those who plunked down hard earned cash to buy. Over the years we have listened intently and taken notes. Much of what we have learned has been incorporated into our new Equilibrium collection. It is a great leap forward both in terms of time keeping ability and accuracy, as well as in a magnificently crafted titanium case and bracelet. No detail has gone unnoticed.

On August 15, 2016, after years of development, testing and refinement I finally held in my hands a fully operational Equilibrium v6 prototype module. It is the heart of the watch, what makes it tick and is an incredibly intricate engineering job. It was a beautiful moment, I almost cried.

The very first photograph of the fully operational EQUILIBRIUM watch module, compared with my trusted world traveling time keeping companion, the marine Zulu.
 


Two of the four layers in the PCB that runs all operations, LCD, analog hand, back light, alarms and power supply.
 


The LCD screen offers the most power consumption effective display available. The wires shown are the invisible connections between the segments, but they are there.
 


The titanium case is machined to extreme tolerances in order to hold the sapphire crystal, 24 hour dial with tritium tubes and watch module securely in place. Double O-rings on all push buttons for 10 ATM water-resistance.
 


Available with your choice of 5 different bezels: 24 hour, AM/PM, Symbol, Solunar and Roman available in black, orange and yellow. These 5 bezels can be fitted to the watch of your choice!
 

A snapshot of what is inside. The PCB has 4 micro thin conductive layers that connects the myriad of components to the LCD, compass, alarm, back light, power and other functions.

 

Quality Is Job Number One.

Manufacturing a quality product is easier said than done. Ask Apple or ask your local microbrewer. The answer will be the same. It takes everything you got and then some. We are honored to work with a team of seasoned watch development professionals out of HK with manufacturing capabilities in China. The Swiss most certainly make some astonishingly beautiful mechanical watches, but the hard truth is that you have to go to Asia for  high-complication quartz and ana-digit watch manufacturing. Various watch parts are sourced from Japan, Thailand, Switzerland and Taiwan. They all specialize in watch making and have decades of experience. Each of them works with a range of sub vendors. Our four key partners are: 

ALPHASOFT. A boutique programming group located on the Hong Kong island. They have been with us since 1999. Our programmer is our rock in HK, I trust her 100%. She is as detailed oriented and caring as they come. 

KEY TIME. A quality watch assembly shop in HK who also specialize in tritium tubes. They have been involved with the Equilibrium development for the last three years. They also manage the titanium case and bracelet manufacturing. 

UDC. A state of the art module manufacturing company. Been part of our development for the last two years. 

RONDA. A state of the art Swiss movement manufacturer with factories in Switzerland and Asia. We have worked with them since 1999.

 

 



 

After a long day working in Hong Kong a walk along the Kowloon water-front offers a spectacular view of Hong Kong Island.
