PRE-ORDERS ARE SHIPPING.Thank you!Our Indiegogo Campaign is over.We are currently shipping pre-orders. We are gunning to get all existing pre-orders shipped by mid to end of February. In February our new web site will go live. You can see a preview of it by clicking on the link below. It is still under some refinement and will keep on evolving, but it is close.http://www.yeswatch.com   The very first order of 3 EQ's shipped to Jan in London.He and another dear friend Lars are quite the wine connoisseurs. You can’t go wrong drinking with these guys. I remember many, many moons ago the three of us sharing some bottles well into a warm summer night in the South of France. Jan offered to put in the first $50K to get the programming started for what eventually became the Equilibrium. Without their bravery we would not be here today. Forever grateful.The Fab Four:Jan, Gunnar, Bjørn and Lars at http://www.solsiden.no in Oslo, Norway.We are very excited to finally bring the EQ to your wrist. The first production batch of EQ’s that we received last week is testing flawlessly, that has gotta count for something. Thanks for your endless patience. Phil Baker has been wearing the Equilibrium for a week. He has been developing and reviewing scores of products for 40 years. Click on this link to see what he had to say: https://pjmedia.com/lifestyle/2017/08/26/a-unique-electronic-watch-thats-not-from-apple/#comments      “It all started out while traveling the Caribbean decades ago. I simply wanted to know when the sun would rise the next morning. Go for a beach walk at the first rays. My gleamingly beautiful Rolex Submariner was of no use at all. So I decided to make my own watch.”           Bjorn Kartomten           Founder, YES watch 
Epic Time Keeping on your Wrist. No other watch on the planet offers the functionality and wealth of time information that the new 24-hour Equilibrium collection from YES watch does. There is no comparison. This is the most unique time piece ever.Many moons ago we decided to grab hold of the true essences of time and make that the foundation of the extraordinarily unique 24-hour watches our team has gone on to produce since 1999. It was not an exercise in design for the sake of design; it was an exercise in design for the most comprehensive presentation of time ever offered on your wrist. It was a calling.At a glance the EQ will give your hours, minutes and seconds as well as times for sunrise, sunset and twilight, moonrise, moonset and moon phase plus alert you to solstices, equinoxes and cross quarter days for exactly where you are. It also has a range of alarms, an electronic compass along with a host of other time data information and features.The unique design has one 24-hour hand and a 24-hour dial to which the multiple circular dials sync up with. These are the Equilibrium hardware specifications:48x17mm titanium case with sapphire crystal in silver-tone or IP black with water-resistance to 10 ATM .-3 or 5 link titanium bracelets with locking clasp.-Choice of silicon, leather and NATO straps.-Choice of 5 rotating bezels in 3 different colors with mirror backed orange/yellow sun/moon stones.-High resolution near white positive TDF LCD. Black negative non TDF LCD by request. TDF means Transflective Display Film which greatly increases perceived contrast in LCD. In a negative LCD however, TDF has an adverse effect.-Inner 24-hour dial with 24 tritium T100 tubes, plus one tube on the analog hand, and a bright luminescent backlight. Together they provide a gorgeous nighttime viewing experience. See this link for more info on what T100 means: http://tritiumreview.blogspot.com/2012/06/tritium-watches_8697.html-The master quartz crystal is attached to the PCB and controls all the timings. This master is connected directly to CPU.  The timing and the accuracy of the Ronda analog drive are also driven from this CPU. The computer controlled analog hand and the digital time is automatically synchronized.-Custom made lithium ion polymer rechargeable battery with 2-3 months of battery life on a full night charge. Expected battery life is 5 years.-Comes in a strong custom presentation box with room for additional straps, jeweler’s tools, recharge clip with USB wire and Instruction Manual.-Two year limited warranty.Even though it looks like it, these pictures were not taken in a submarine, but in a bar late at night. Regardless of circumstances the tritium tubes and backlight will make nighttime reading crystal clear.Following the Sun and the Moon.Once you study time keeping beyond the springs and screws and luxury bragging rights they have made you think it is all about, you will find a millennia long timeline of fascinating evolution, understanding and history. Calendars and time keeping were spawned by the heavens above, by the sun and the moon, everything else followed. It is in this realm of wisdom and awareness that the Equilibrium finds its platform and ancestry. What a fashionista might be hawking as trending today is kinda completely irrelevant. Time is timeless.-This is the man-made time data the Equilibrium keeps track of.-Hours, minutes and seconds in AM/PM or 2400 format-City name. 587 cities worldwide have been pre-programmed into the watch. It can also be set by LAT/LON, TZ and DST-Year, date, month and day-LAT/LON-TZ and DST   -DOY & WEEK #Any quartz movement has an accuracy of about plus/minus 20 seconds a month. It comes with the territory. In the EQ software program we have added a +/- 60 seconds accuracy adjustment capability of the quartz oscillator. Once you have determined the variation in your watch you can trim the EQ to an accuracy of plus/minus 1 second a month.  The Circles of Time in the Equilibrium.Time isn’t linear and it isn’t just a number. Time is spatial and it is alive. The stunningly detailed LCD in the EQ takes a hold of this universal knowledge and creates a display of circular dials that will relate your space and time to the rotation of the earth and to the cycles of the sun and the moon.The black 24-hour circle of time.This is by far the most essential time in society today. Everything runs according to it. Jet planes, shops, rock concerts, what have you, it all relates back to this time. When something begins and when it ends, when to meet, when to leave. In 1883 the powers that be divided the world into 24 time zones, on average 15 degrees each, even though over land the TZ border follows geographical specifics and can vary greatly. All time calculations in the Equilibrium are based on UTC time.In the EQ the 24-hour dial has a tritium tube for every hour and markers at quarter and half hours.The orange sun circle.Next to the 24-hour dial the orange sun circle gives you the time data for the sun. Sunrise and sunset, times for morning and evening twilight, solar high noon or zenith, and finally solar midnight. The dark area gives you nighttime, the checkered part gives you twilight and the light orange part indicates daytime.The yellow moon circle.The inner yellow circle will give you time for moonrise and moonset and lunar high noon or midnight. When the moon is up and when it is down. This circle can also be used to display SR/SS for an alternate location.The moon phase display is accompanied by waxing /waning arrows.The AM/PM circle.Just outside the 24-dial, on the titanium collar that holds the crystal in place there is a shiny/satin finish on the two halves indicating AM/PM from 0000-1200The outer circle, the rotating bezel.Offered in five different bezel insert designs in three different colors. You choose which one makes the most sense for you.At the push of a button the following time data will read out in the dot-matrix. It is accurate to plus/minus 2 minutes:-Times for sunrise/zenith/sunset/civil twilight/nautical twilight/astronomical twilight-Times for moonrise/lunar noon/moonset/% luminance/date and time of next new moon/time and date of full moonAlerting you to solstices, equinoxes and cross-quarter days.On the 8 main turning points of the sun the inner yellow dial will alert you to the event.  The inner yellow circle will display a gradual checkered pattern as the year progresses. At the top of the hour the event name as well as exact time for it is displayed.The EQ pictured above and below has been fitted with the solunar bezel, which creates the cleanest design. If less is more, this is the one for you, but any of the 5 bezels in black, orange or yellow metallic will look great. The bezel, as well as the strap colors, are yours to pick, tell us which one you want. "If you're like me and want the ultimate watch that would do absolutely everything except perhaps tell time on Mars, then the YES Equilibrium is the watch for you. I've been beta-testing this watch for the past 3 or 4 months and have fallen in love with both its functionality and its design. I never had a watch that generated so much interest. When people see it and hear my words of praise, they ask where they can get one! Of course, a watch with so many features requires investing a small amount of start-up time to figure out how to really use the features. But that's a small cost in exchange for so much benefit.The beta version had a few problems with power consumption, along with some minor design flaws here and there. But these have now been attended to and the final, commercial version of the watch should be available in a few weeks. I can hardly wait!"     John Casti, Vienna, Austria 
Click on this link to see a video of how you Change the Cities in the Equilibrium:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d6jqE2A61YY&t=6s
 
 
Please note that the watch pictured above will have a yellow and black bezel in the final version.The ultimate time partner that handle battlefields as well as boardrooms.I think of this as the workhorse in our EQ collection. The subtle wear-resistant satin finish case fitted with a sturdy 5-link Jubilee bracelet in lightweight titanium and a sapphire crystal can’t be beat. No matter how rough and tumble your life style is my guess is that you are going to need sleep way before this watch will quit on you.Pilots, astronomers, travelers, military personnel, outdoors men, boaters, healers, scientists, bon vivants and watch collectors alike will all find the EQ of great intelligence offering coordination no ordinary watch can ever match. There is no end to what tasks or events customers have told us their YES watch has helped them approach with calm, confidence and success. The EQ takes time keeping to the next level, it takes guessing out of time.Check out this link for some stories from our past:http://www.yeswatch.com/wrist-watch/timekeeper/press-news.html  Twilight, this most magical time of the day, has been included in the EQ. At a glance the checkered pattern in the outer orange sun circle will give you the combined duration of all three of them. By pushing a button you can get the exact range for civil, nautical and astronomical twilight to the minute.Click on this link to see video of the Time Review feature in the Equilibrium:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pe_uJ2npgy8 The black beauty.There is something about black that is always beautiful. Like that little black dress that all women have in their closet. Who knows what the attraction truly is, but here it is on the Equilibrium. 10 micron deep black IP plating, polished to a high gloss on the case coupled with the classic Presidents bracelet.There isn’t a single calendar in the history of humanity that hasn’t attached itself to the sun. During each year we cycle through its 8 main turning points: 2 equinoxes when the days and nights are identical in duration, 2 solstices where the sun is either at it highest or lowest in the sky and 4 cross quarter dates halfway between each of them. As you study calendars you will find that cultures worldwide have repeatedly linked faith-based celebrations around these events. The EQ alerts you to every one of them. At the top of the hour the dot matrix will spell out its name and time of passing for exactly where you are to the minute. No other watch on the planet does this.  Click on this link to see a video of the different Modes of the EQ:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zzEmzKrZ6Ow The choice of professionals.If sometimes you need stealth, unobtrusive power or just must to be in the know, then this is the watch for you. The tough black all satin case finish with a near scratch proof sapphire crystal will faithfully stand by your timing task at hand.Any quartz movement have an accuracy of about plus/minus 20 seconds a month, it comes with the territory. You think the 32768 vibrations per second would guarantee accuracy but by time the oscillator has been manufactured you got variations. In the EQ software program we have added a +/- 60 seconds accuracy adjustment capability of the quartz oscillator. Once you have determined the variation in your watch you can set the EQ to compensate for it to the second. A very nifty feature, the IM will tell you how.  Click on this link to see the different Alarms in the EQ:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_39lGon_lM Mind over Matter.In a mindful and beautiful design that focuses on content, application and wear, while throwing fads and frills to the side, the Equilibrium is for those who are ready to graduate from the ordinary to the special. This is the one that carefully and accurately reconnects man-made and natural circadian rhythms. This is for the part of your soul that nurtures a free and independent thought. This is your time.Alarms, stopwatch, 7 languages and a compass.Watches are always in one form or another about timing. To that end we have added a range of alarm options to the Equilibrium. The alarm sound may not wake you from a deep sleep but it certainly is loud enough when you are waiting for a sign. Here they are:~Daily Alarm. This is your regular set alarm with a 10-minute snooze.~99 minute timer.~Sunrise/set alarm. Chimes at event time with pre-alarm time of 0-60 minutes as set by user.~Cuckoo alarm. Like Grandpas old clock, chimes at the top of the hour with 00 -24 hour range set by user.~999 day countdown/up with user set event date.~Regatta Alarm. The official countdown sequence used in official regattas. Automatically converts to stopwatch when start is successful.All the alarms relate to whichever location your watch is set for.The Equilibrium also has a stopwatch with lap times that counts to 1/100 of a second. Lap times kept in memory for review until the stopwatch is reset.The 7 languages for menu settings and readouts are: English, Spanish, German, French, Norwegian, Italian and Portuguese.The spot on accurate electronic compass has N/S/E/W arrows and a digital readout of degrees. The analog hand will stay fixed at 1200 which will align to 00 N readout. The practical applications and insights ofthe EQ are endless.There is no end to the uses and tasks customers have told us their Yes watches have enabled them to manage better and with greater accuracy. The Equilibrium is a superior tool for confident timing. It is also a great conversation starter.World travelers. Instantly ground yourself to local time. Carefully used it can effectively help you overcome jet lag. Once you set your location the hand and LCD display sets itself automatically compensating for TZ and DST.Astronomers. With the added feature of twilight, your best time to view the universe just became even more accurate to predict.Photographers. Professionals can plan for the best natural light conditions and when to shoot throughout the day and night. You can plan to shoot at the golden hour, to up your Instagram game!Military. Operations are critically planned around the availability of light, or the lack thereof. They got bin Laden on a moonless night, it was not a coincidence. The 2400 time display makes it a natural for the Special Forces.Pilots. Flying changes dramatically after dark, like night and day. All of a sudden you see nothing, except maybe artificial lights and the horizon disappears. If JFK junior had an EQ he might have been the President today.Boating. The same goes for boating. The last thing you want to run into is a rock or a log after dark. Much better to be in harbor or anchored before the sun is setting.Motor biking. Driving changes drastically after dark. In an unfamiliar spot especially, you might be best off planning to be back at the hotel before the sun goes down.Outdoorsmen. Not much brings you closer to nature than camping, fishing and hunting. With the EQ you can predict the rhythm of day and night exactly. Plan the activities with complete confidence.Watch collectors. If you are a watch enthusiast your collection is not complete until you have one of these unique timepieces. You can only have so many watches giving you hours, minutes and seconds before they are all just the same.Moments of sanctuary. A quiet time, a prayer or a kindred ritual aligned with the divine rhythms of the sun and the moon makes the experience just so much richer and stronger. Try it sometime. Insights of great timing for thosewho travel light. For the world traveler there isn’t a better wristwatch out there. Not only does the EQ give you time for 600 cities worldwide adjusted for TZ and DST, but it also instantly grounds you to the local rhythm of day and night and your place in it. With this unique insight you can help overcome jet lag quicker and plan your activities to safely do things before and after dark sets in.If you are way out there the EQ can also be set by your actual LAT/LON giving you sun and moon time data to an accuracy of plus minus 2 minutes. Click on this link to see a video of how the Compass in the EQ works:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=njJ0uiLan-Q Your bezel­ choice.The rotating bezel offers the ability to keep track of an additional universe of time keeping at a glance. It has been around for a long time, most prominently used on dive watches. Knowing how long you could stay submerged were of critical importance, nobody wanted the bends.With the unique day and night perspective in our watches we have designed 5 bezels that each offers a different function. You choose yours. With your Indiegogo pre-order send me an e-mail at bj@yeswatch.com to indicate which one you want, please include IG order number.The bezels will also be offered for sale individually as replacement or exchange for $39 each.The bezels are omni-directional to allow for maximum accuracy in adjustment. We have paid extra attention to getting a firm friction on the bezel to keep it stay in one place once set.The bezel inserts are held in place by strong double stick tape. The IM will tell you how to exchange them. The bezel insert you tear out will most likely not be usable again, but it is a great way to refresh your watch when the time comes. Your titanium bracelet choice.There is no stronger and arguably no more beautiful metal bracelet than the classic 3-link President design. The 5-link follows a close second. The high gloss shiny EQ case gets the 3-link bracelet, the more subdued satin case get the 5-link. That goes for both silver-tone and black versions. The bracelet lug nuts are 22mm and will fit any standard bracelet. The bracelet is attached with heavy-duty spring pins.When pre-ordering an EQ with metal bracelet, please send e-mail to bj@yeswatch.com with your preference. Replacement bracelets will be available for sale on our web site. Your leather, NATO and silicon strap choices.We found a cool black leather strap with a checkered pattern that plays well with our watch and bezel design. For a tan strap the classic plain one is the one that counts. All the buckles will have the logo engraved. There are a gazillion NATO straps out there. We are starting with these three. The orange will light up just about any room. The  silicone straps offers a comfortable and solid wear if rough and tumble is part of your daily life. When you buy a watch with the titanium bracelet you get one of each, with your choice of color. Let me know which colors when you pre-order.If you go for the $590 pre-order pick the one strap you want, let me know at bj@yeswatch.com and we’ll fit it on for you.All the straps will be for sale individually on our web site. Packaging custom built for secure worldwide shipping.The Equilibrium watch is held firmly in place in a velvet cradle and will be wrapped in a sheet of protective vinyl. Next to it is a small compartment with a padded lid that will stay firmly closed even if the package does a couple of somersaults on its way to you. Inside is room for the recharge clip and wire, the jeweler’s tools, the bezel oil and other knickknacks needed to keep your new watch humming. The lid has a drawing with buttons and basic watch functions called out. Behind the ledge that holds the instruction manual in place are two elastic pockets for spare straps and bracelets. A solid hinge with firm resistance will keep the strong, lightweight plastic box shut tight even if it happens to roll around in the back seat of your car. Very nice, very sturdy, very practical. We will set the watch before shipping.The astronomical algorithms of the sun and the moon are complex. The Equilibrium has a wealth of time keeping data and it is the kind of watch were you want to read the Instruction Manual to get full use of it. You will find the operations to be quite intuitive, but for starters you are going to want to spend some time with it to familiarize yourself.Smart watches and phones only last a day or two; with the EQ you can go on a long vacation and not have to worry about the battery. The battery lasts for at least 30 days, and that is far better than most rechargeable watches on the market.  Recharging the EQ battery.The perpeteum mobile has yet to be invented even though we keep on trying. The EQ has a hardcore lithium recharge battery set-up. We custom built the battery for maximum size, thinness and longevity. Simply clip the charger on to your watch, make sure the contact are clean and engage, the clip light will turn to red when it happens and leave it in overnight. It will be green in the morning. It connects via a regular USB contact to your computer or battery adapter.The critical part about a rechargeable battery is to never let it go flat and sit like that for any length of time. It will forever diminish its ability to hold a charge. Charging it before it goes really low is the best policy. Nothing lasts forever, after an estimated 5 years you will have to replace the battery. Watches and water will always be at odds.Decades ago the term water-proof was used, but since nothing truly is, take anything deep enough and it will leak, the industry changed the term to water resistance back in the 70’s. This is measured in ATM.  The EQ is constructed to 10 ATM. This means it can be taken down to 100 meters depth without leaking.  It also means, and many watch buyers don’t know this, that the crown or buttons cannot be operated while submerged or in contact. If you do you will momentarily breach the double o-ring seal and the outside water pressure will turn your watch into an aquarium quicker than you can say it. Now you know.I have been ocean swimming with the EQ for weeks now and I am confident that with normal use the internal cavity will stay perfectly dry.  Reconnecting the cycles of the sun and the moon with hours, minutes and seconds.I guess you can say it all started on a beach in St. Barts back in the mid 90’s. I simply wanted to know when the sun would rise the next morning. To catch the first rays on a quiet beach walk. My gleamingly beautiful Rolex Submariner was of absolutely no use at all.I checked around and quickly learned that the daily passing of the sun, the most fundamental timekeeper of all, had never ever been captured in a wristwatch. How come it had been ignored? I quickly learned why. Only through incredibly complex astronomical algorithms based on latitude and longitude could the sun’s path and timing be predicted accurately. I decided to make my own.At first I wanted the watch to be a mechanical masterpiece. At the 1997 Basel  fair I arranged a meeting with an engineer with the renowned German watchmaker Glashutte. After speaking for a few minutes he just smiled and cut me off. He said that if I wanted to capture all that time data in a mechanical movement, I would be carrying a backpack. We laughed and had another beer.It proved that only with digital chip technology was it possible to capture the nuanced cycles of the sun and the moon on your wrist. A curious dichotomy and blessing inextricably entwined.In 2002 the Worldwatch II was updated to include times for moonrise and moonset. Big strikes back.In 1999 we incorporated the YES watch company in Marin County, California and got to work with our Swiss and Hong Kong partners. Creating perfection was and is a whole lot easier said than done, but 18 months later we proudly released our first collection, the WorldWatch.It was a rude awakening. In spite of being a very lean and mean time machine, the case measured in at a solid 43x16mm. The size prompted a nearly wholesale rejection in the market place. Thank you!  Listening intently.There is no better product feed back than what you get from caring customers, from those who plunked down hard earned cash to buy. The wires shown are the invisible connections between the segments, but they are there. The titanium case is machined to extreme tolerances in order to hold the sapphire crystal, 24 hour dial with tritium tubes and watch module securely in place. Double O-rings on all push buttons for 10 ATM water-resistance. Available with your choice of 5 different bezels: 24 hour, AM/PM, Symbol, Solunar and Roman available in black, orange and yellow. These 5 bezels can be fitted to the watch of your choice! A snapshot of what is inside. The PCB has 4 micro thin conductive layers that connects the myriad of components to the LCD, compass, alarm, back light, power and other functions. Quality Is Job Number One.Manufacturing a quality product is easier said than done. Ask Apple or ask your local microbrewer. The answer will be the same. It takes everything you got and then some. We are honored to work with a team of seasoned watch development professionals out of HK with manufacturing capabilities in China. The Swiss most certainly make some astonishingly beautiful mechanical watches, but the hard truth is that you have to go to Asia for  high-complication quartz and ana-digit watch manufacturing. Various watch parts are sourced from Japan, Thailand, Switzerland and Taiwan. They all specialize in watch making and have decades of experience. Each of them works with a range of sub vendors. Our four key partners are: ALPHASOFT. A boutique programming group located on the Hong Kong island. They have been with us since 1999. Our programmer is our rock in HK, I trust her 100%. She is as detailed oriented and caring as they come. KEY TIME. A quality watch assembly shop in HK who also specialize in tritium tubes. They have been involved with the Equilibrium development for the last three years. They also manage the titanium case and bracelet manufacturing. UDC. A state of the art module manufacturing company. Been part of our development for the last two years. RONDA. A state of the art Swiss movement manufacturer with factories in Switzerland and Asia. We have worked with them since 1999.   After a long day working in Hong Kong a walk along the Kowloon water-front offers a spectacular view of Hong Kong Island.

story:
In the past 20 years, the US has lost millions of textile jobs. If you don't believe us, take that t-shirt off your back, and look at the tag. It was probably made in Honduras or Indonesia or China or Mexico where workers make 3-11% of what textile workers in the US make. Additionally, manufacturing t-shirts takes over 700 gallons of water to make, and a t-shirt at Wal-Mart in the US has already traveled over 10,000 miles before it is ready to be sold to you.

With that said, we all crave a t-shirt that represents our political position, and in our culture of polticial divisiveness, when you wear a shirt supporting our President, you are making a statement-- a strong one:

You believe that more Americans deserve health care, and the growing disparity between the rich and poor hurts our economy and that students should not have to pay high interest loans just to get a higher education degree. You also believe that in America- we can still make stuff, and pay people a fair and living wage to produce it.

When you support this campaign, you are not only choosing the greenest way of supporting the president, but you are also creating fair wage jobs in the USA. The "Obama That Shit" t-shirts and the blankets will be made at NuPath, a non-profit outside Boston that creates employment opportunities for people with disabilities.

"Obama That Shit" shirts are made by cutting out letters from fabric materials and sewing them on either your t-shirt or a random-ass used t-shirt. Blankets are made by using 1 square foot from each t-shirt you send us and using the fronts of the shirts for the front of the blanket and the backs of the shirts for the back of the blanket (see here for examples).

The 10,000 dollars will be used for making die cuts so that we can ramp up operations of our 'Obama That Shit" campaign and create a green fashion option for the 60+million people that will vote for Obama this fall. 

10% of all proceeds from this campaign will be donated to Moveon.org

story:
"I desire to make something that people have not yet seen before."--Cyril Lumboy

About Me 

Inspired by the Japanese street fashion, Lolita, I am a self-taught designer who creates one-of-a-kind dresses and accessories. I have created my own brand called dolldelight. I really like the fact that since my dresses are all handmade and not mass produced, each piece is a unique work of art. I love continuing to create and inspiring others to create as well. I hope that wearing my pieces makes each of you truly feel like the doll that you are!

What the Funds Are For

I have been fortunate enough to have an overwhelmingly positive response to my pieces, so much so, that I can't keep up with all the production. The funds raised on IndieGoGo will help me to create and share my work internationally in conventions and expos.

I have received many custom orders and interest in my participation in fashion shows, but in order to be able to keep up with the demand, I need to expand my production. While I’m open to mass producing the smaller pieces, like bows, I want to keep the dress production one-of-a-kind and customized. I think that this is what sets me apart from other designers and I think people love owning a piece that is unique and made especially for them.

What You Get--The Perks!!

Most of my perks are meant to be very personal and customized. I am so happy to have the opportunity to connect with people in this way and to be a part of this culture that I find so much inspiration, creativity and beauty in.

Check out my perk video!! 

 

dolldelight Fully-Customized Lolita Dresses

I have the unique opportunity to offer fully customized Lolita dresses to 10 backers!! Each dress will be chosen in both design and fabric by YOU! You will also get photo updates of your dress being made before finally being shipped to you with a handwritten note from me. This process is so special to me because not only is the dress your creation as well as mine, but you will be the only person with this exact dress! 

dolldelight Bows

I have two different levels for beautiful bows!! You can choose from either a double layer or a triple layer bow, and you will get to choose from a few different fabrics. These lovely accessories are the perfect accent if you feel like getting dolled up, or just want to turn a normal day into a delighful one!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Southern California Tea Parties

I'm also thrilled to be able to offer three tea parties as perks! This will give us a chance to get all dolled up and enjoy sweets and tea in the highest fashion while playing games and having a blast! I love meeting with fans and fellow Lolitas and this unique opportunity will allow us to meet in an intimate setting. Each tea party has a tentative location but will require at least 2 backers in order to happen. Each backer will have to make their own travel arrangments to get there. Here are the details...

  • Los Angeles: Four Leaf Tea and Cakes http://www.fourleaftearoom.com/
  • Orange County: Paris in a Cup http://parisinacup.com/ 
  • San Diego: Pangea Bakery--Private Event Room http://pangeabc.com/

 

Why dolldelight

When I first began sewing, I never dreamed that it could take me to where I'm at now. I truly believe that as long as you follow your dreams and feel inspired, you have the capability to do whatever you heart desires. Being involved in fashion, particularly Lolita fashion, keeps me feeling creative and keeps me seeking new outlets for beauty. This brand is very dear to me and that is why I want to keep the production small and customized. I think that this is what sets me apart from the mass produced designers in the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I want everyone to be able to be a part of this unique experience. Every dollar that you contribute will get me one step closer to reaching my goal of taking dolldelight international. I want to share my creativity for fashion with the world and also continue to be inspired by others around me. 

If you are unable to contribute, please share this project with other Lolita fans who might want to claim some of the great rewards I'm offering. Share on Facebook, Twitter and any other social media sites you are a part of. 

Press

Check out some of the recent press for Doll Delight!

  • Kababayan LA with Janelle So, Part I
    • Part II
  • Halo Halo with Kath Iniba
  • TsouLA with Bell Tsou
  • The Orange County Register
  • Balita
  • The Daily Guardian
  • Filipina Specializing in Asian & Lolita Fashion 

 

Shout Outs:

Psycho Bando for providing our campaign video music! Check out their single Fight! Kikkoman FTW at

http://psychobando.com/

story:
There's one fear that everyone can relate to: the panic of losing a loved one.

 

Chills, stomach-churning, racing heart, sweat and heavy breathing… Can you imagine not knowing where your child is?

You don't have to. Not ever again.

We present you FINDSTER.

Findster Kids

Thanks to Findster, you are always connected to the ones you love.

Findster tracks your loved one's activity and location, keeping you informed on their health and safety.

 

FINDSTER has been featured on:


Findster is a new and innovative GPS tracking system working towards the safety of your loved ones, finding them whenever you want to. Compared to other systems on the market, Findster is free of charge. There are no monthly fees! That's what makes us your best choice.


There are two primary devices: one for you and one for your loved one. They are wirelessly connected to each other and all you need to make them work is the Findster's App on your smartphone.

 
Using the Findster app, you can follow their position in real-time and receive alerts if they leave previously defined safe areas. You can monitor multiple Findsters at the same time and share access with family and friends
 

Security zones


When the Child leaves the defined security zone, you receive an immediate alert on your Findster App, giving you the time and opportunity to react. If the connectivity between the two modules is lost, the last detected position is saved and you can revisit past locations making it easy to find where your loved one is. If this happens, the Findster ecosystem activates the alert mode and all other modules start searching for the lost Child. When they find it, they send its current location through the cloud to the Parent/Guardian’s smartphone App.

 

 

Make sure you are everywhere.


Support Findster now and be one of the first to have it, at a very (very) limited special price. Once you get it, you can use it forever WITHOUT MONTHLY FEES!
 

A short term step for a long term peace of mind.

 

Features

 

 

Findster’s Secret Sauce


The Child module was designed specifically to be comfortable when applied yet secure. This module includes a high-precision GPS system and a 3-axis accelerometer that enables the detection of whether the child fell!
 

Innovative wireless communication technology
 

One of the Findster secrets is in its innovative wireless communication technology, used to establish communication between the child module and its guardian/parent module (or the child module and the Base Station).

Our proprietary wireless protocol allows you to obtain communication range of 0.62 miles (1 km) between both modules, thereby eliminating the need to send the coordinates through a cellular connection. In this way, we have removed the required monthly fees that are intrinsic to other GPS tracking systems on the market.

 

 

You can increase the range and capabilities 
of Findster.
 

The Findster ecosystem is composed of 5 components: 
- Parent/Guardian module
- Child module
- Portable charger
- Smartphone App (Android and iOS).
- Basestation (optional)

 

The Parent/Guardian module serves as a gateway between your smartphone and the module, enabling a long-range bi-directional communication between both. All the controls and displays of data are centralised in the Findster App. 

 


To increase the ubiquity and range of Findster you will be able to add a base station. It can be placed in strategic points, expanding your connection area and protecting who you care about even when you're not home.
 

The basestation can be placed, for example, in your home, powering a communication range of 1.24 miles (​​2 km). The basestation wireless communication uses the same proprietary protocol of the child module. However, because it has no restrictions in terms of battery consumption or size, we were able to design a system with a range 2x greater than the wearable module.

 

Imagine your workplace is far from your residence. As long as you have a base station at home, you can continuously track your child in your neighbourhood. Being away from home doesn't mean you can't be connected to those dearest to you.

And because each basestation has a wi-fi connection, even if the child leaves your home’s security zone, when approaching another basestation it is automatically re-connected with your smartphone through the Cloud—always guaranteeing your privacy. 

Only you and those who you have authorised can have access to data modules.

 

 

If your neighbourhood joins Findster by getting additional base stations, the protection zone becomes even bigger. These base stations can also be placed in schools and playgrounds to increase the area of protection. The larger the Findster’s web, the more omnipresent you become.

 

 

Technical Specifications

 

 

Dimensions

 


Software

 


Why we are different

 

Findster represents the next generation of GPS tracking systems, allowing a solution that combines the ubiquity of use without the need for monthly fees.

 

 

Why we need you

 

We have been working hard, and Findster is finally a fully functional prototype. Now we need your help to guarantee its mass production.

We’re at the starting line, ready to begin. Support us and be the first to get one.
Join our project and share it with your family and friends.
Together we can go even further and take Findster to the next step.
 

Why should you help us? It’s simple:

- Be the first to get one and benefit from a very special price
- Always be connected to the ones you love and guarantee their safety
- Be part of our history; let’s do it together

 

Rewards

 


For a retailer package,  email us.

 

The Findster Team


We don’t solve problems. We prevent them. And we have a proven track record in this.

We are a multidisciplinary team with years of experience in engineering, design and physics.
 


We came together with the sole purpose of creating and developing technologies that will improve your quality of life. Our goal is to bring security and peace of mind to everyone.

Findster is our way of doing it.

 

Risks and Challenges


Like any innovative project, the development of Findster presents some risks and several challenges. Over the past few months, the whole team has worked to ensure that none of the risks and challenges prevent us from a timely delivery of the system with the quality that our supporters deserve.

We worked with our supply chain to ensure that production will take place as scheduled. We have a fully functional prototype and we are currently working on the final version of the system.
 


The Findster team has developed other innovative technologies that combine software with hardware. We have the manufacturing flow line prepared, as well as the protocols for testing and validation of various critical components of our system.

We are absolutely sure that – with your support – Findsters will become a reality in time and with the quality you deserve.

 

FAQ

 

1. How can I contribute to the campaign? 

Anyone can contribute. You just need to have a PayPal account to pay the perk. If you do not have a PayPal account but have a credit card, you can use the "Pay as guest" feature in PayPal.

For instructions on how to Pay as a Guest on PayPal, please visit:  How to Contribute via PayPal without a PayPal Account.

 

2. How many modules can be connected to the parent/owner’s module simultaneously?

Up to 5 modules simultaneously.

 

3. What type of battery is used in the modules (rechargeable or replaceable)?

The Findster modules use rechargeable batteries. To recharge the battery module, simply connectthe module to a Findster Charger (included in the perk) or insert it into the basestation .

 

4. Can other unauthorised modules be connected to my kid's module?

Not unless they are explicitly allowed (monitoring group).

Other guardian modules could serve as a gateway for sending data to the web service, but only if there is authorization from the owner of these modules.

 

5. How is the connection established between Findsters? How does the guardian’s module connect with the smartphone?

The pairing of the modules is made possible via the mobile application.

In the smartphone, you can see a list of compatible Findster modules and the desired module is selected using its identifier (name associated with the device), similarly to a Bluetooth connection. This connection only needs to be done once.

 

6. Why are two modules necessary?

The Findster’s secret sauce is its proprietary RF technology that allows for two modules to communicate in a range of up to 1km. If we were using just one module to communicate with the smartphone – as a Bluetooth tracker does – then we would only be able to achieve 50m of communication range.

We weren’t satisfied with that range, so we’ve developed our own technology. It adds an extra module to the system but enables us to communicate at a range of up to 1km.

 

7. What happens if the smartphone is too far from the guardian's module?

With Findster you will never be able to lose your guardian modules anywhere. What Findster does is it constantly monitors the distance between the smartphone and the guardian module. If this distance is greater than a preset threshold, an alert is posted on the smartphone.

 

8. When my kid is missing, will other Findster users be able to help?

Yes, because Findster has networking capabilities. A missing child can transmit its location anonymously using other Findsters. The information is relayed through our web service to its destiny.

 

9. What is the purpose of the basestation?

The basestation (BS) allows you to extend the coverage area of the Findster network. Since the base station does not have the same power and space constraints of the Findster modules, we were able to devise a more powerful version of our RF communication system.

Moreover, being Wi-Fi enabled, it establishes a link between the base station and all your Findster modules, even if you’re outside of your home. So, once the BS is connected to the Internet, parents/guardians will be able to track their kids remotely.

The base station also serves as a charging dock for up to 4 modules simultaneously.

 

10. Is data privacy guaranteed?

Yes, the Findster system ensures that only authorized modules have access to the data exchanged between them.

 

11. Can I share access to my child module with other people I trust?

Yes. If the module is associated with an account, its owner can easily share access with other users and create a network of caregivers.

 

Check our complete FAQ here.

Yes, because Findster has networking capabilities. A missing child can transmit its location anonymously using other Findsters. The information is relayed through our web service to its destiny.
 
9. What is the purpose of the basestation?
The basestation (BS) allows you to extend the coverage area of the Findster network. Since the base station does not have the same power and space constraints of the Findster modules, we were able to devise a more powerful version of our RF communication system.
Moreover, being Wi-Fi enabled, it establishes a link between the base station and all your Findster modules, even if you’re outside of your home. So, once the BS is connected to the Internet, parents/guardians will be able to track their kids remotely.
The base station also serves as a charging dock for up to 4 modules simultaneously.
 
10. Is data privacy guaranteed?
Yes, the Findster system ensures that only authorized modules have access to the data exchanged between them.
 
11. Can I share access to my child module with other people I trust?
Yes. If the module is associated with an account, its owner can easily share access with other users and create a network of caregivers.
 
Check our complete FAQ here.

story:
Hi, I'm Amari Xaymaca and your support on this project would be invaluable to me.  I received my Associates of art degree in Merchandise Product Development from the Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising. I have interned for Reformation, Asher Levine, Peter Som, and Dolce Vita Footwear where I went on to be the DV Apparel Design Assistant. This campaign is important to me because it is the opportunity to see my vision come to life. After working and interning for other people, designing and helping them realize their dreams, it would be wonderful to finally achieve the first step of this goal I have been working towards. If you contribute to this campaign you will not only be helping me to fund samples to take to different trade shows, you'll be contributing to me eventually achieving my biggest goal for my career-- to have my own fashion line. You'll be helping me push the envelope on contemporary fashion. Xaymaca, named for my Jamaican heritage, is a line that through conceptually themed collections will push boundaries and really reach into the stories that can  be told through our clothing. 

    What We Need To Achieve This...


    • The biggest goal of this campaign is to be able to have well made samples created from my original sketches. With this comes a lot of people and these people have to get paid. Though  I make most of my patterns myself. I will need to be able to pay a pattern maker to create 2-3 patterns for the collection. On average a great pattern make may cost anywhere from $20 an hour to $100 a pattern and more depending on the garment. In addition to that I will need to pay a sewer. Though I myself do sew, I am still not the best seamstress and I would like a proper sewer to construct the garments so that they can have all of the inner and outer beauty I imagine. There is also a need to buy yardage of fabric. I am working with mostly Linen and Voile with some other beautiful textiles infused through out the collection. In order to obtain quality fabrics that have a great hand so that the garments feel nice on I will have find the best quality I can find and this will cost somewhere around $18 per yard. Since we care about sustainability in fashion a lot of the fabrics will also come from dead stock, still we do not want to sacrifice the quality of the garments in doing so making it important to have the funds to buy the best qualities. Also 3-4 pieces will need to be screen printed and this will add in additional costs. Then there is also the need to buy trims ie: Zippers, Hook & eyes, Buttons.  Though I estimate this will cost about $10,000 over all. I am shooting to raise $15,000 in case any thing comes up. For example during fittings if a new style needs to be created, if the over all pattern has to change so much that the original sample can not be used I would like to have the necessary funds on hand to meet any challenges we come across with creativity.If I don't reach my entire goal, a bulk of whatever I do raise will be used to pay the sample sewer, buy fabric, and pay the pattern maker. I may do less styles, and sacrifice some of the screen printing. 

      A Little Confidence Goes Along Way

      Because of my background in fashion working as a Design Assistant, I am confident that I have the knowledge to successfully complete collections from concept to completion. The most challenging parts of this will be coordinating everything to line up with tradeshows, meeting deadlines, communicating with people in other areas  I will use my knowledge of sourcing and find the best places to put the funds, work within the budget that I will create and communicate through my network of fellow designers to get things done.

      Contribute in anyway you can

      Please make any contribution you can. You can spread the word or give feed back. You can contribute funds or offer a service you have. No matter how you contribute it matters to me. You matter and your support is appreciated!

      FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM: Xaymaca.Apparel

story:
Relegate 3D glasses to the history books and usher in a new era of Hi-Res NaturalVision3D (TM), that you see with your bare eyes.

Yes, you read it correctly. We've developed both hardware and software to rid everyone of the most cumbersome part of viewing 3D: the glasses. You will be able to watch High Definition TV, go to the movies, capture live events, capture 3D video of your kids and make content for others to view and see it in 3D with your own bare eyes. Our NaturalVision3D (TM) technology is already working as we speak. We are looking for backers to be able to move from the prototype stage to the product stage, and improve on our next generation versions. Our company is EosVision Inc, based in Arizona, and we hope we are about to change the world. Our technology reaches almost every industry where you can see. Our mission is to provide technology to enable a complete Capture, Stream, and Display of NaturalVision3D (TM). 3D is definitely alive, and will soon become the norm, if we have anything to say about it. You will tell your children and grandchildren about the "olden days" when TV and movie viewing was flat, and they will look at you with disbelief and confusion in their eyes, and say funny things like: "What?; How did you live like that?"

Applications:

  • Affordable 3D video, adventure broadcast and home video.
  • Medical video capture, internet transmission and display.
  • Real 3D gaming entertainment.
  • 3D video conference - FaceTime, Skype chat, etc.
  • NaturalVision3D TV's for home and business.
  • Desktop displays for CG movie production, CAD and product design on computer. Model, Animate, Render, and see the results without waiting for conversion.
  • nv3D enabled OS desktop with hovering icons and depth windows 
  • Ultimate theater technology - immersive theater of the future, no glasses needed. 
  • Online 3D real estate home tours. Set yourself apart and offer buyers a more real, size, space and outdoor view, of homes and locations.
  • Product images on websites where you can see the depth of what they really look like.
  • 3D UAV flyovers played back on large nv3D enabled screens.
  • 3D Surveillance footage with access to computed depth and size of objects in the image, with our software.
  • Our exciting "Room with a view" concept (see below in Products and Potential)

nv3D Advantages

What's in it for you?

We're giving 500 people a chance to try one of our displays and give us feedback and consumer insight, as we move through the development, in exchange for you contributing $379 to the project. Smaller displays in the past were only available to an elite few, and started at $4,000. We're giving you a chance to try our technology for just $379. If you're not quite ready for that level, but still want to help advance the technology, then for a contribution of just $40, $65 or $99, we're giving away a full pro version of the same visual FX software that's been used to create FX for some of your favorite movies, TV series, music videos and games (valued at $1195). Check it out here: (www.projectmessiah.com). Some of its users have been nominated for Academy Awards, and were just everyday people like you, who wanted to make an animated short, or get a job working on a movie, and just needed to show what they could do. Use it yourself, resell it at a profit once the campaign ends, or donate it to a school or friend looking to break into the business. Help someone else get their dream off the ground, and get a good feeling for it. If you're not in a position to contribute yet, that's okay too; you can still help by passing the word on, and making others aware of what we're doing.  

A Sneak Peek at our Prototype 3D Display, Software and Test Camera

It's hard to "see" what our display can really do, without seeing it live, just by the nature that it works with your two eyes. We are relying on the fact that people are already familiar with 3D from seeing movies and TV with glasses, and can understand the possibilities and excitement of finally removing glasses from the equation.  After thinking about it for awhile, I thought of a way that might give you a tiny bit of something different when you look at it on here, and it seemed to work. When you take a still of our display in a certain way, the image of a video being displayed in 3D seems to look a bit different than a normal image. 

Below is my 6 year old daughter, Sophie, helping me demonstrate, with a bubble maker spraying into the air. If you sit back about 2 feet or so from your monitor and look at her compared to the background and bubbles, some of you might be able to notice an unusual amount of separation and focus between her and the surroundings. The effect is obviously 100 times more dramatic when you see it on the display with your own eyes; but this is about as crafty as I could be with the optics for you to see something that you ordinarily shouldn't be able to notice with essentially one eye (camera) and then looking at it on your normal 2D screen. If you look at the bubbles at the top, especially the one right above her head, to some of you, it may actually appear to come out of your screen a tiny tiny amount. When you see it on the display, with your two eyes, looking in the desktop window makes you feel like you are looking into a tiny set; where you can see all the way back to the wall behind her, and she and the little bubbles come out of your screen and float in the air about a 1/2 inch to an inch from the face of the display, and it feels like you can reach out and pinch them between your fingers. 

Close up view of the display

Below is the startup panel to our test software. You can choose if you are displaying from images, from live cameras (internet, webcam, local etc.) and what format you want to display in (720P, 1080P etc). By setting it to server mode, you can have the software broadcast its 3D image to a receiving client through RTSP. The software is written in a combination of C and JAVA.


nv3D Startup Panel

Here's our test camera, with a few controls so we can try out tiny adjustments, and experiment with different arrangements and distances. It captures two images at 1080P at 30 FPS and live feed to a laptop through USB. We have successfully done up to 8 cameras simultaneously capturing and displaying live at 50FPS in debug mode.

Close up view of the camera. Kind of looks like a little happy robot head.

The Developers

We're a small group of people that have dared to take on the impossible before. John Prince and I, (Fori Owurowa), along with a small group of supporters have spent time combining our expertise in our respective fields, spending the last few months refining ideas and inventing methods for low cost production of the technology.  John has had a long career in optics and creating interesting things like thin film superconductors, and copper vapor lasers. I have developed industry changing and fast 3D technology and software for many years (see: the current multi-award winning messiahStudio6 3D animation and rendering software www.projectmessiah.com), and you can look me up on (www.imdb.com) for some technology and visual effects credits. Both of us have had our share of pushing past what people have told us was too difficult, too expensive, or seemed impossible, so this challenge fell right in line. During this project, we were literally two guys toiling away in a room, who discussed ideas for crazy things like: evaporating Sapphire, making flat radio telescopes, curved light, and the physics of how walls know the future of balls, over burgers and chili at lunch in Palo Alto and Arizona. We've developed a range of ideas over this time, in many different industries, and now we're ready to start raising money to put them into practice.

Background of the Idea

I met John in Arizona back in Feb of 2013 through Brad Carvey. John was looking for someone to write some software who understood something about 3D and what he wanted to do; and Brad made the connection to me. John and his partner, Aleta, came into town and we met for lunch to discuss what they were doing, and where they were with it all. It was one of those things where you sit down and you're talking to someone, and where someone else would usually think "this guy is talking crazy", you instead understand exactly what they are talking about and immediately start to think about how to solve it. It was great to meet someone else with a "let's do it", "lets start working on it right now" attitude. John gave me the freedom to start pure, without limitations and we'd narrow things down later. A lot of the things we came up with were wild and wonderful, but much too expensive for just the average person, or way beyond the budget we had to try them yet. We decided that one of our criteria was to also create a technology that would be affordable, so it could be added to devices that made it accessible to everyone, relatively easy to manufacture, and create a format that was flexible and easy for other companies to adopt and license, so a wide variety of products could be created beyond what even we would think of. Nine months of ideas, testing and building, led to several breakthroughs with capture, streaming, and displaying. We had something that actually worked amazingly well, given the low precision tools we had to work with, and the stuff we built ourselves. John likens what we were doing to trying to achieve semiconductor precision with stone tools. We combined materials and invented our own processes where we couldn't find something that existed, or that we could get fast enough.  We made our own prototype camera, software, format and display, so that we could not only test the ideas, but prove that they worked. You know you've been working on something a lot when you walk into Lowes and Home Depot so many times finding obscure parts and pieces to modify, that a guy who works there yells: “there he IS !”, when he sees you, as if he knew you would show up again sometime that day.
We soon realized that the simple tools at our disposal would only take us so far in squeezing out those last bits of precision, and limited which ideas we could try; so it became clear that to move to the next level, the types of things we would have to buy, would be beyond what we had for this project. While exploring funding possibilities, we took advantage of great resources like TechShop (www.techshop.ws) to help us try out fabrication and product design ideas on machines that we didn't have yet. It's a great place with great people that work there, that deserves a look if you are an inventor, or just someone wanting to try to start making things just for the fun of it.

Picture of us cutting curves in a 2" thick block of Acrylic with the waterjet cutter at Techshop Chandler, AZ


What drove us to this?

Over 80% of 3D capable TVs purchased, have rarely been watched in 3D. People just don't want to bother wearing the glasses, or the extra expense of having to buy them for each person that wants to see. Can you imagine everyone at a sports bar trying to watch a game and wearing 3D glasses? or sitting all day in front of your desktop monitor taking on and off glasses to see 3D content or products online. That just didn't seem practical. If you're someone who wears glasses already, did anyone consider the fact that you have to put glasses over your glasses, to watch 3D? Young kids have a hard time keeping them on, and originally the one size fits all nature didn't fit their faces, so many parents just opt to see the 2D version of movies. We are daring to eliminate all of this forever. Creating a technology that adults, toddlers and even your dog can now view. We've put about all we can into this stage to make it a reality to a good level, but to really get it to where we'd like it to be, requires more expensive equipment than the two of us can provide, so that's why we're here; hoping that you see the same potential that we see. We ask that you put aside any preconceived notions; take a leap of faith, and a bold step into the future of possibility; and help us cast affordable NaturalVision3D (TM) depth into the eyes of all those who dare to see it. This is truly a chance to be part of technology history. At least we'd like to think so :)

Products and Potential

We're in the business of enabling people and companies to use and create new products with our technologies. In addition to the normal uses of enabling 3D cameras, displays, and software with nv3D ability, we'd like to introduce a concept that we're developing that wasn't possible until now. We present ......

A Room With A View

A new concept in office and home environments: "A Room With a Live NaturalVision3D View". Think of it as, the window re-imagined. Take any home or office space room or cubical and create a personal digital window, with a 3D view of whatever you like, that you or anyone else passing by, can see without 3D glasses. We're working on creating an online system of broadcast views around the world, of beautiful and interesting places that people can tune into with their window. This window content can be still or live, and it's changeable to different things and locations whenever the mood suits you. Want a view of the beach?...tune into the live beach view and see the sunrise or set, time shift matched to your time zone, and see it like you were looking out of a window, in NaturalVision3D. Want an Aquarium wall display without the mess, that never gets old?...tune into the underwater view channel and see a window with life that is ever changing. You never know what may pass by. See the cycle of a day and night as you go through your day and night, where you are. Need a moment high in the mountains, or deep in the forest? Add 3D sound broadcast to complete the experience. A hidden waterfall in a far away place, creates a peaceful and inviting environment for lobbies, waiting rooms and spas. Watch a rainstorm move across the plains of America from your NY apartment. Want to look across your office while you work at a view of whales migrating live as the sun sets on a beautiful beach in Hawaii? You will.

Do you have an exciting view or want to capture adventurous footage to share with other people all over the world? Many of us will never experience jumping off a mountain and flying through the air in a Wing Suit, or exploring a deep ocean trench, but we will at least have a better chance to see it, like you do. We're enabling people to have their own channel on our site and broadcast to everyone. Fund scientific research with a subscription channel where schools and everyday interested people can see fascinating things about your work, that they otherwise would never experience. Stand on the edge of a Volcano, so we can see and hear what you hear.  We have the ideas and the technology that can makes it all possible. Capture->Stream->Display->EosVision.

Fund Use and Timelines

We are looking at being able to deliver the first beta units to funders to try out in about 4-6 months.

  • Buy equipment & materials (1-2 months).
  • Test a few more versions and finalize designs & processes (1-2 months). We have the ability to do this in-house.
  • Explore manufacturers to produce and partner with (2-3 months). We have plans to meet with some in just a few weeks. 
  • Start to manufacture (3-4 months).
  • Launch ViewChannels(TM) on our new site, to begin basic broadcast of 3D RoomWithAView(TM) feeds and content.
  • Estimated shipping for hardware to begin in September 2014 (based on perk level, certain products will ship sooner than others). messiahStudio6 software will be available to backers to download within 2-3 weeks of meeting our goal. Updated messiahStudio6.x with nv3D experimenter module available to funders via download estimated in September 2014.

Our capabilities:

  • nv3D (TM) display technology. Allow creation of new displays, or change current ones, to show NaturalVision3D (TM) content.
  • nv3D image format - Enable the creation of images that will be seen on NaturalVision3D enabled devices. Add to your software or display firmware.
  • Real-time capture software, to broadcast locally or to internet client.

What will be available to people:

In addition to products using the technology,  we're trying to plan the ability to create your own 3D ViewChannel, and provide free, or subscription based content to the world, through our "RoomWithAView" system. Broadcast view environments, exploration, adventure video, art and photography, science and educational content, that you can update whenever you wish.

We won't think of everything, so if you have other uses that you would like us to enable and explore, drop us a line. imagine@eos-vision.com

you instead understand exactly what they are talking about and
