someone else with a "let's do it", "lets start working on it right now" 
attitude. John gave me the freedom to start pure, without limitations and we'd 
narrow things down later. A lot of the things we came up with were wild 
and wonderful, but much too expensive for just the average person, or way
 beyond the budget we had to try them yet. We decided that one of our 
criteria was to also create a technology that would be affordable, so it
 could be added to devices that made it accessible to everyone, 
relatively easy to manufacture, and create a format that was flexible 
and easy for other companies to adopt and license, so a wide variety of 
products could be created beyond what even we would think of. Nine months of ideas, testing and building, led to several breakthroughs with capture, streaming, and displaying. We had something that actually worked amazingly well, 
given the low precision tools we had to work with, and the stuff we built ourselves. John likens 
what we were doing to trying to achieve semiconductor precision with 
stone tools. We combined materials and invented our own processes where 
we couldn't find something that existed, or that we could get fast enough. 
 We made our own prototype camera, software, format and display, so that 
we could not only test the ideas, but prove that they worked. You know 
you've been working on something a lot when you walk into Lowes and Home
 
Depot so many times finding obscure parts and pieces to modify, that a guy who works there
 yells: “there he IS !”, when he sees you, as if he knew you would show 
up again sometime that day.  We soon realized that the simple tools at our disposal would only take us so
 far 
in squeezing out those last bits of precision, and limited which ideas we
 
could try; so it became clear that to move to the next level, the types 
of 
things we would have to buy, would be beyond what we had for this 
project. While exploring funding possibilities, we took 
advantage of great resources like TechShop (www.techshop.ws) to help us try out fabrication and product design ideas on machines that we didn't have yet. It's a great place with great people that work there, that deserves a look if you are an inventor, 
or just someone wanting to try to start making things just for the fun 
of it.Picture of us cutting curves in a 2" thick block of Acrylic with the waterjet cutter at Techshop Chandler, AZWhat drove us to this?

Over 80% of 3D capable TVs purchased, have rarely been watched in 3D.
 People just don't want to bother wearing the glasses, or the extra 
expense of having to buy them for each person that wants to see. Can you
 imagine everyone at a sports bar trying to watch a game and wearing 3D 
glasses? or sitting all day in front of your desktop monitor taking on and off glasses to see 3D content or products online. That just didn't seem practical. If you're someone who wears 
glasses already, did anyone consider the fact that you have to put 
glasses over your glasses, to watch 3D? Young kids have a hard time 
keeping them on, and originally the one size fits all nature didn't 
fit their faces, so many parents just opt to see the 2D version of 
movies. We are daring to eliminate all of this forever. Creating a technology that adults, toddlers and even your dog can now view. We've put about all we 
can into this stage to make it a reality to a good level, but to really 
get it to where we'd like it to be, requires more expensive 
equipment than the two of us can provide, so that's why we're here; 
hoping that you see the same potential that we see. We ask that you put aside any 
preconceived notions; take a leap of faith, and a bold step into the 
future of possibility; and help us cast affordable NaturalVision3D (TM) 
depth into the eyes of all those who dare to see it. This is truly a 
chance to be part of technology history. At least we'd like to think so 
:)Products and Potential

We're in the business of enabling people and companies to use and create new products with our technologies. In addition to the normal uses of enabling 3D cameras, displays, and software with nv3D ability, we'd like to introduce a concept that we're developing that wasn't possible until now. We present ...... A Room With A View
 A new concept in office and home environments: "A Room With a Live NaturalVision3D View". Think of it as, the window re-imagined. Take any home or office space room or cubical and create a personal digital window, with a 3D view of whatever you like, that you or anyone else passing by, can see without 3D glasses. We're working on creating an online system of broadcast views around the world, of beautiful and interesting places that people can tune into with their window. This window content can be still or live, and it's changeable to different things and locations whenever the mood suits you. Want a view of the beach?...tune into the live beach view and see the sunrise or set, time shift matched to your time zone, and see it like you were looking out of a window, in NaturalVision3D. Want an Aquarium wall display without the mess, that never gets old?...tune into the underwater view channel and see a window with life that is ever changing. You never know what may pass by. See the cycle of a day and night as you go through your day and night, where you are. Need a moment high in the mountains, or deep in the forest? Add 3D sound broadcast to complete the experience. A hidden waterfall in a far away place, creates a peaceful and inviting environment for lobbies, waiting rooms and spas. Watch a rainstorm move across the plains of America from your NY apartment. Want to look across your office while you work at a view of whales migrating live as the sun sets on a beautiful beach in Hawaii? You will. Do you have an exciting view or want to capture adventurous footage to share with other people all over the world? Many of us will never experience jumping off a mountain and flying through the air in a Wing Suit, or exploring a deep ocean trench, but we will at least have a better chance to see it, like you do. We're enabling people to have their own channel on our site and broadcast to everyone. Fund scientific research with a subscription channel where schools and everyday interested people can see fascinating things about your work, that they otherwise would never experience. Stand on the edge of a Volcano, so we can see and hear what you hear.  We have the ideas and the technology that can makes it all possible. Capture->Stream->Display->EosVision.Fund Use and TimelinesWe are looking at being able to deliver the first beta units to funders to try out in about 4-6 months.
Buy equipment & materials  (1-2 months). 

Test a few more versions and finalize designs & processes  (1-2 months). We have the ability to do this in-house. 
Explore manufacturers to produce and partner with  (2-3 months). We have plans to meet with some in just a few weeks.  
Start to manufacture  (3-4 months).
Launch ViewChannels(TM) on our new site, to begin basic broadcast of 3D RoomWithAView(TM) feeds and content.

Estimated shipping for hardware to begin in September 2014 (based on perk level, certain products will ship sooner than others). messiahStudio6
 software will be available to backers to download within 2-3 weeks of meeting our goal. Updated messiahStudio6.x with nv3D experimenter module available to funders via download estimated in September 2014.
Our capabilities:

nv3D (TM) display technology. Allow creation of new displays, or change current ones, to show NaturalVision3D (TM) content. 

nv3D image format - Enable the creation of images that will be seen on NaturalVision3D enabled devices. Add to your software or display firmware.

Real-time capture software, to broadcast locally or to internet client.
What will be available to people:In addition to products using the technology,  we're trying to plan the ability to create your own 3D ViewChannel, and provide free, or subscription based content to the world, through our "RoomWithAView" system. Broadcast view environments, exploration, adventure video, art and photography, science and educational content, that you can update whenever you wish.We won't think 
of everything, so if you have other uses that you would like us to enable and explore, drop us a line. imagine@eos-vision.com

story:
We started Dick Moby because we wanted to address the plastic pollution of our oceans in a positive way. We both love the ocean. Growing up surfing and sailing we’ve experienced the plastic pollution first hand. 

Being both designers we are passionate about quality and sustainability. So we want to see if we can make something positive out of plastic and address the problem of plastic pollution at the same time. 

Over the past year, with the help of a lot of friends and the clever people at our production company and suppliers, we designed a beautiful collection of sunglasses, made out of a new bio-acetate. 

Wholesale price
We offer our sunglasses for the wholesale price of €77 / $106 / £64. 
When our campaign succeeds the sunglasses will cost €135 / $185 / £112 in selected stores.

Don't like it? Return it!
We know the quality of our sunglasses and are sure you will love them but if for any reason you're not happy with them we will exchange any pair of Dick Moby sunglasses that you send back to us. And if necessary return your money. Because our margins are really tight we will have to charge you for the shipping costs.



We've teamed up with the Surfrider Foundation. And we are proud to announce that 10% of our revenue will be used on projects with them. Projects that will address the plastic pollution and help us find ways to create a bright future for plastic and for our oceans. 

The reason we wanted to work with the Surfrider Foundation is that we are surfers ourselves, and we wanted a partner that has experience and understands how we think. Because working with like minded people always gives better results.

So.. Look good, do good and join our movement!
Check out the special color combination available; the Surfrider Foundation colab. 

Normal sunglasses are made from a regular acetate which is an oil based plastic. The product we use is M49, a new innovative bio-acetate produced from only renewable resources.



Dick Moby is a ZEISS certified partner, which means that we get to use their premium line lenses. The best available; full UV protection, increased contrast and an anti scratch layer. You are going to love every second of looking through these lenses!  




Personalise fit

Our sunglasses are made of a thermoplastic. This means that it’s possible to personalise the shape of the temples at your local opticien. 


Free shipping in the Netherlands. European shipping €8. UK shipping £6,6.
US/CA shipping $22. AUS/NZ shipping $20. You have to include the shipping costs on top of your Indiegogo perk, since Indiegogo doesn't automatically do this. 

Please bare in mind that any import taxes for your country will be your responsibility.


We understand that choosing the right model can be difficult and we will do our best to exchange any pair of Dick Moby sunglasses that you send back to us. Because our margins are really tight we will have to charge you for the extra shipping costs.


We truly believe that quality and sustainability should go hand in hand, so we didn't want to create packaging you would just throw away. We came up with a beautiful packaging made out of thick and sturdy recycled cardboard, a soft inside and a magnetic seal so that it can be used as packaging by also as a protective hardcase. 




It's been an epic journey and after 10 months of hard work, high-fives, a lot of beer, a few whiskeys, laughs, some frustrations and trips to France, Italy and England the results are here! 

We started sketching and making the first cardboard prototypes in May 2013.
In September we’ve met up with some experienced eyewear designers from London, who helped us to bring our sketches into 3D models with the right dimensions and ergonomics to create the ultimate fit. We’ve visited factories and suppliers in November and by January we had worked out the deals with all of them. Everybody is waiting for the results of this campaign, so we can start production. Almost go time!


Check our our progress photo album on Facebook.

We absolutely love our sunglasses and we're sure you will too.


All designs are finished, the first prototypes have been made and we are in the last stages of tweaking the sunglasses to a perfect fit. We'll continue to fine tune the models during our campaign as well. No big changes, just some finishing details

Metal DM initials on the inside of the temple tips

Small  ‘D’ and ‘M’ gold coloured metal plagues will be pressed in the acetate cover with lacquer. Only visible when you close your sunglasses. Smooth sailing.


Time schedule 2014

Indiegogo campaign (8 March - 20 April)

Final round of prototypes, to tweak the last details (April)

Start of production (April - May)

Surprise packaging add-on!? (May)

Expected delivery (June)

When you support us by ordering a pair of sunglasses, you’ll not only receive your shades this summer, but you will also be helping us realise our dream and supporting us and the Surfrider Foundation, in our mission to address the plastic pollution of our oceans.


Break-even

Our break-even point to start production is €35.000 / $48.000 / £29.000.
Your support will pay for necessary tooling costs and the start of production.


There are risks and challenges with every undertaking but in creating a product from scratch there are definitely a few. 

We know the drill

Our personal and professional lives have seasoned us perfectly for this challenge. We both had businesses before, we know the drill! Tim has a background in graphic design and advertising and Robbert in fashion design. Combined we know what looks good and we have the knowledge to tackle design and development. 

Best of the best

To make this project a succes we have searched and found the best factory and suppliers, we visited them all. We became ZEISS certified partner, and we’ve worked with eyewear experts from London to get the best possible pair of sunglasses. The design, fit, materials and production partner put our sunglasses on the same level as many of the A-brands out there, sometimes even higher. After testing our prototypes on all different shapes and types of faces we are confident that there is at least one fit perfect for you.

Delivery in June 2014

While, as with anything, there can be surprises we feel confident that we can deliver this product on schedule in June 2014. In the lead up to delivery we will respond to all of your enquiries as promptly as possible, keep you up to date on our progress, and work as hard as we can to get you your pair of Dick Moby sunglasses as soon as possible.


Are the sunglasses made from recycled plastic?

No, we’ve put a lot of time into researching if we could use the plastic waste from our oceans to make the high quality sunglasses we envisioned. Unfortunately this wasn't possible. We still continue to research innovative ways of recycling with experienced companies like www.crem.nl and www.terracycle.com.

What is eco friendly about the sunglasses?
We use an innovative bio-acetate that is produced from renewable resources.

Can I return the sunglasses if I don't like them?
Yes, we understand that it’s possible that you pick the wrong pair from just seeing the photo's and measurements. We will be more than happy to send you any different model or colour in return. You do need to help us with the shipping costs.

What happens when Dick Moby doesn't reach 500 supporters?
We are going to work hard not to let that happen!
But if it does, you will get your money back. 

What can you do to help?
Of course getting one of our perks means the world to us! Also sharing our video and story with friends and family via social media would help us a lot. You can use the Indiegogo social sharing tools, its very easy.



Please get in touch with us, we would love to hear your feedback.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Sally. Half of you are probably visiting straight from Facebook and know me already, but for those who are browsing Indiegogo with a tenner burning a hole in their paypal account that they're just dying to spend helping someone get their dream started, allow me to big myself up:

I'm a freelance all kinds of things; a pole dance and fitness instructor, a fire dancer, former media luvvie but my real passion is outdoor sports. I love snowboarding, rollerblading, SUP boarding, climbing and like to pretend I can skydive. While I'm new to this game, I have years of transferable experience in running a small business, networking and selling.

I've always aimed to align my true loves with my career - something that never runs smoothly but always makes for an interesting life! - but I'm really going for it here with my own range of extreme sports apparel. Nothing too technical initially, some cool t-shirts, vests and hoodies with hand drawn designs, am emphasis on comfort and easy wearability (not a word, according to the red squiggle, but you get what I mean) and working with models who are real surfers, skaters etc. and not just pretty faces.

I've had a pretty good start, with a rather funky raglan and a cute girly cropped vest in production as we speak and pre-orders coming in, but with a cash boost I can really increase the range and - perhaps more importantly - focus on some little branding details like additional labels and hang tags that really make the difference to the quality of the products.

I'm super-passionate about this, and even the smallest contribution would bring the smiles :)

What We Need & What You Get

Every new design has a minimum order number from suppliers. This means it gets expensive very quickly to have anything like a decent range. Your contribution will help to increase the diversity of what we offer. More designs = more likely there's something for everyone = bigger business.
I'm also looking to invest a large part of what we raise here into branding. Additional labels, custom packaging, swing tags. These little touches are the things that really give a product quality when you get it in the mail. It would also mean I can approach potential retailers with products that pop.  
  

Risks & Challenges

 

I am quietly confident that this is a good product and that slow, sensible business growth is a better plan than wild borrowing and spending. Any contributors can be assured that their perks will be prioritised and funds will be allocated to the facets of the business described above - expansion, and branding.

(Paypal's terms also require me to say that delivery of perks is not guaranteed)

Other Ways You Can Help

- Follow Voodoo Tuesday Apparel on Facebook and invite your friends to like the page too.

- Follow us on Instagram Voodoo _Tuesday_Apparel

- If you're an extreme sports enthusiast with a good look and a decent social media following, get in touch! You just might be our next brand ambassador!

- Let us know about any retail outlets (skate shops, surf shops, sports venues like climbing walls, tattoo and piercing places) that might be interested in stocking Voodoo Tuesday Apparel

story:
Our Story

Hi everyone, my name is MJ. I’m passionate about sharing what I have learned in working with some of the most enlightened brands--particularly with college students, our future change-makers. In my 20 years of branding, marketing and communications work, I have been fortunate to work with companies and non-profits on issues of conservation, climate change, organics, sweatshops, autism, clean energy and many more 21st century challenges.

But I have never before been able to CREATE a product in the global economy where we live that demonstrates the best way to make it, and the most honest way to sell it. 

Some call this authenticity. We think of it as having Integrity.

We set out to make something as basic as underwear, and to mark each step with integrity: the fabrics, the people who sew the product and the packaging. We want to use our model of business to inspire college students and consumers nationwide how to vote with their wallets by choosing products made with sustainable fabrics, fair labor and transparent marketing. Since 98% of apparel sold in the U.S. is made overseas, we have a LONG way to go toward understanding where these products come from and in improving how we make and market them. We thought we would start with the basics - underwear.

 

How TRU2U works with students & organizations

We see the more than 45,000 college students in our town alone get excited when they learn about their role in the global economy and the impact they can have by investing their dollars in great products, fair labor and honest talk. This is what we call TRU - 2 U, your friends, your commmunity and your world. 

TRU U

Because our products were inspired by students and are for students, we will carry out our TRU U program on campuses around the country (starting with the 5 colleges where we work and live), and then expand to other colleges where students can sell TRU2U underwear and dormwear to earn money for their social change organization. We call this our TRU U program and we believe it helps to incubate young change-makers, like the ones working in our office everyday in Amherst, Mass.

 

DESIGNED BY STUDENTS 

Students will create limited edition designs, carry out social networking and take part in an active and vibrant business. In fact, TRU2U was inspired through student designers as a project at the Minneapolis College of Art and Design. In keeping with that spirit, we believe that TRU2U can inspire change from within young people once they connect with the makers of their products and communicate more about these TRUfacts, helping more individuals be TRU2 themselves, their friends and family, their own community and to the global community from which we buy products everyday.

Made With Integrity - no matter where in the world. 

Our NGO partner, Verité Fair Labor

To be true on the ground in our factories overseas, we partnered with Verité, the global NGO that works to improve conditions in factories and to train companies, investors, governments and other key players in the global supply chain. Verité will guide our factory program, help us to continually improve as we expand to new countries and to be a model for other global brands to show that Made with Integrity is profitable. A built-in part of our doing business will be to support Verité in an on-going fashion to improve the global supply chain programs it has around the world. 

 

Ready to Launch


We have designed simple and basic styles made from micro modal and organic cotton and are ready for our first order from our factory in Turkey (our fabrics and colors are so soft and luscious). 

With your help at indiegogo, we will place our first order for sales at the end of  2012. Investing in our TRUperks will bring you into the TRUcommunity of supporters and believers, and you can earn discounts on future purchases. Only $50 gets you a limited edition Founders T-shirt.

WHY TRU2U MATTERS

Our Made With Integrity approach will be a game-changer for brands who compete around the world only on price without consideration of sustainable materials, decent conditions and wages, environmental consideration or honest marketing. Our initial website, media assets (print and video) and guerrilla tactics were designed in collaboration with students from many institutions over the last 3 years. During this time, we have had 15 interns, 5 staff, and built a senior management team to grow. We want to show that our vision for transparency and participation, at the student and grassroots level, is alive and well.

WHAT WE NEED

When we reach our goal of $25,000, we will be placing our first order for on-line sales, sending you value from your pledges and naming you as a Founder.

You will be part of our first TRUstories that inspire others for a new way to make, wear and share.

Show us your TRUcolors today and help found a new model of doing business globally.
story_txt:
Our Story
Hi everyone, my name is MJ. I’m passionate about sharing what I have learned in working with some of the most enlightened brands--particularly with college students, our future change-makers. In my 20 years of branding, marketing and communications work, I have been fortunate to work with companies and non-profits on issues of conservation, climate change, organics, sweatshops, autism, clean energy and many more 21st century challenges.
But I have never before been able to CREATE a product in the global economy where we live that demonstrates the best way to make it, and the most honest way to sell it. 
Some call this authenticity. We think of it as having Integrity.

We set out to make something as basic as underwear, and to mark each step with integrity: the fabrics, the people who sew the product and the packaging. We want to use our model of business to inspire college students and consumers nationwide how to vote with their wallets by choosing products made with sustainable fabrics, fair labor and transparent marketing. Since 98% of apparel sold in the U.S. is made overseas, we have a LONG way to go toward understanding where these products come from and in improving how we make and market them. We thought we would start with the basics - underwear.
 
How TRU2U works with students & organizations
We see the more than 45,000 college students in our town alone get excited when they learn about their role in the global economy and the impact they can have by investing their dollars in great products, fair labor and honest talk. This is what we call TRU - 2 U, your friends, your commmunity and your world. 

TRU U
Because our products were inspired by students and are for students, we will carry out our TRU U program on campuses around the country (starting with the 5 colleges where we work and live), and then expand to other colleges where students can sell TRU2U underwear and dormwear to earn money for their social change organization. We call this our TRU U program and we believe it helps to incubate young change-makers, like the ones working in our office everyday in Amherst, Mass.

 
DESIGNED BY STUDENTS 
Students will create limited edition designs, carry out social networking and take part in an active and vibrant business. In fact, TRU2U was inspired through student designers as a project at the Minneapolis College of Art and Design. In keeping with that spirit, we believe that TRU2U can inspire change from within young people once they connect with the makers of their products and communicate more about these TRUfacts, helping more individuals be TRU2 themselves, their friends and family, their own community and to the global community from which we buy products everyday.

Made With Integrity - no matter where in the world. 
Our NGO partner, Verité Fair Labor
To be true on the ground in our factories overseas, we partnered with Verité, the global NGO that works to improve conditions in factories and to train companies, investors, governments and other key players in the global supply chain. Verité will guide our factory program, help us to continually improve as we expand to new countries and to be a model for other global brands to show that Made with Integrity is profitable. A built-in part of our doing business will be to support Verité in an on-going fashion to improve the global supply chain programs it has around the world. 
 

Ready to Launch

We have designed simple and basic styles made from micro modal and organic cotton and are ready for our first order from our factory in Turkey (our fabrics and colors are so soft and luscious). 
With your help at indiegogo, we will place our first order for sales at the end of  2012. Investing in our TRUperks will bring you into the TRUcommunity of supporters and believers, and you can earn discounts on future purchases. Only $50 gets you a limited edition Founders T-shirt.


WHY TRU2U MATTERS
Our Made With Integrity approach will be a game-changer for brands who compete around the world only on price without consideration of sustainable materials, decent conditions and wages, environmental consideration or honest marketing. Our initial website, media assets (print and video) and guerrilla tactics were designed in collaboration with students from many institutions over the last 3 years. During this time, we have had 15 interns, 5 staff, and built a senior management team to grow. We want to show that our vision for transparency and participation, at the student and grassroots level, is alive and well.

WHAT WE NEED
When we reach our goal of $25,000, we will be placing our first order for on-line sales, sending you value from your pledges and naming you as a Founder.
You will be part of our first TRUstories that inspire others for a new way to make, wear and share.

Show us your TRUcolors today and help found a new model of doing business globally.

story:
Windsor Neckwear 

Windsor Neckwear is the standard of style, exclusivity, and originality in mens neckwear.  It is our mission to provide products that allow today's modern man the ability to "Stand Out While Fitting In".  We believe that it is important to offer accessories that bestow a man the opportunity to express his individual style through fashion in a manner that causes him to stand out from the crowd in a positive light.  With this one goal in mind Windsor Neckwear continues to evolve and grow as a brand with continued commitment to grow and create new products that will allow our customers the ability to stand out while fitting in.

Windsor Paisley Necktie from the Platinum Collection

We offer handmade 100% woven silk bow ties and neckties with high thread counts, self tipping and wool blend inner linings to create a neckwear masterpiece that you will enjoy for years to come.  Each of our silk neckties and bow ties are limited edition as we only offer 25 pieces of each design. Additionally Windsor Neckwear offers high quality woven polyester made with high thread counts for durability, and vivid colors for our complex designs.  At Windsor Neckwear we value making quality products along with providing excellent customer service at a supreme value.  We would like to sincerely thank you for taking the time to visit our crowd funding page and we know that you will enjoy your neckties and bow ties for a long time to come.

Why Give To Windsor Neckwear

Windsor Neckwear is a provider of premium men's neckwear.  It is our mission to provide products that allow our customers the ability to stand out while fitting in.  Our silk neckwear is sold in limited editions of 25 pieces per style and color making them very desireable and rare.  Our silks are of the finest quality and neckwear made with excellent craftsmanship and construction.  By taking part in the Windsor Neckwear crowd funding campaign you will have early access to the new premium products that we will be offering in our new collection. 

Additionally you will become a part of what we believe will be an inspring story and journey in mens fashion.  Windsor Neckwear is poised for growth but we need you.  Our company has developed relationships to offer more premium products into the marketplace and we believe our time is now.  With your contributions you will take part in growing a brand that will continue to make beautiful, fashionable products that you will enjoy for years to come.

Value & Benefit

Our Value Proposition:

Most neckwear that is comparable to ours in price range is made in quanitities of 1,000 plus per design/color.  Our competitors average limited edition necktie or bow tie is made in a product run of about 100 pieces per design/color and on average starts at $110 and up.

At Windsor Neckwear we offer all of our designs from our Platinum Collection in limited product runs of 25 pieces per design/color in high quality silk fabrics with an average of 114 picks.  Our limited edition neckwear is sold for $45 to $65 per tie/bow tie which is a fraction of our competitors cost with the same superior quality and construction. We feel that by doing this we offer superior quality at with extreme value for our customers.  Because of this our products tend to sell out very fast.

 

What happens if we get completely funded?

Next Steps

We already have all of the necessary neckwear manufacturing processes in place.  We have gone through the process of figuring out what designs are best, color schemes, materials to use and dimensions that offer the best look from big and tall to standard neckwear.  With a completely funded program we will be able to lower our overhead on neckwear and pass the savings on to our customers.

Dress Socks - We have built relationships with a very reputable dress sock manufacturer who is ready for us to submit our order to be produced in 8-10 weeks.  The socks will be made from 70% Cotton 30% Nylon Blend in several cool colors and patterns from stripe, argyle, paisley and patchwork.

Sock Samples from the Walk In Comfort Collection

Cufflinks - We have submitted designs and currently awaiting our samples for our custom designed cufflinks.  Windsor Neckwear has enlisted the support of a manufacturing facility that has over 25 years of cufflink making experience in stainless steel and sterling silver.  We plan to launch the collection with 10 beautiful designs sold in limited quantities of 50 per style.

 

Custom Necktie Cufflink Sketch

Dress Shoes - The Walk Collection will offer beautiful design and quality. It is our goal to release 10 pairs of in stock ready to wear dress shoes in 2013.   If we get fully funded we will have more negotiation power and be able to offer a full leather upper dress shoe from $150 to $200 per pair depending on the design and features of each shoe. They will also be limited edition as our other products only offering up to 100 pairs per style. 

The Wingtip Dress Shoe from the Walk Collection

   

(Left) Windsor Paisley from AEJ Bowtie Collection

(Right) Prestigious Stripes from Platinum Collection

Windsor Neckwear Handrolled Pocket Square

Our Campaign

We are ready to take Windsor Necwkear to the next level and we need your help to do so.  We are passionate and excited about where Windsor Neckwear has come from and where we are going as a brand.  It is our plan to be a household name in mens accessories providing high quality items at an affordable price.  We have put in every ounce of passion, time and sacrifice to grow Windsor Neckwear to the point we are today.  We also understand that we need people to be successful. Your contribution will make you a part of a true success story, showing how nothing is impossible with hard work, dedication and passion.  

Kensington Stripes Necktie

What We Need & What You Get

We need$30,000 to meet the minium requirements of our goal.  If we reach  $50,000 we can lower overhead cost which will allow us to offer better price points to our customers.  Below is how we will allocate the funds for $30,000 and $50,000.   

$30,000 Spending

  • $12,000 New Neckwear Collections
  • $4,000 To do first run of Walk In Comfort Sock Collection
  • $5,200 On Google Ad Words Campaign
  • $3,000 On Cufflink Production
  • $2,800 On Textile Design Software
  • $3,000 Towards getting 501c3 status to begin non-profit work

$50,000 Spending

  • $16,000 New Neckwear Collections
  • $4,000 To do first run of Walk In Comfort Sock Collection
  • $3,000 On Cufflink Production 
  • $8,000 On Our Ready To Wear Dress Shoe Collection
  • $2,800 On New Textile Design Software
  • $7,000 To Develop New Dress Shirt Collection
  • $6,200 On Google Ad Words Campaign
  • $3,000 Towards getting 501c3 status to begin non-profit work

If we don't reach our entire goal what portion of the funds we do raise will go to production of new neckwear, dress socks and our google adwords campaign. The most pressing issue is that we need to increase product production of our neckwear to keep up with customer demand due to the limited nature of our products.

The Perks

Please Note that contributions are open ended. You can give whatever you desire by clicking contribute now. 

$5.00

Windsor Neckwear will give you a shout out on twitter and recognize you on the crowd funding page at www.windsorneckwear.com

$25

You will receive a $35 e-gift card to use on any item of your choice and 10% off all purchases for six months.

$30

Receive a four pair bundle of dress socks from the Walk in Comfort Collection. Retail value $40

 

$50

You will receive a $70 e-gift card to use on any item of your choice and a 10% off all orders for one year.

$50 Limited Edition Bow Tie

Contribute $50 and receive a custom silk bow tie only made for those who contribute to this perk. It will be a 3 inch butterfly style bow a beautiful argyle  design. This bow tie will not be sold online and is only available here. 

 

Fabric Sample for Limited Edition Bow Tie Package


$80

Receive a limited edition silk necktie custom designed for those who contribute to this package. Additionally you will receive three pair of socks from the upcoming walk in comfort collection.

$100

You get an e-gift card valued at $200 to use towards any neckwear or new collections set to launch in 2013, and 15% off all orders for 12 months.

$95 (limit at 10)

Be the first to own a pair of our ready to wear Walk Collection Dress Shoes.  This 100% leather loafer will retail for $150 get it now for just $95 only 10 will be sold at this price. We will contact you for size information.

$95 (limit at 10)

Be the first to own a pair of our ready to wear Walk Collection Dress Shoes.  This leather and suede wingtip will retail for $150 get it now for just $95 only 10 will be sold at this price. We will contact you for size information.

$700 (limit at 100) The Custom Package

Are you a member of a group, fraternity, organization, club or business owner that wants a custom designed logo necktie or bow tie?  This is the package for you.  Get 50 custom designed silk ties or bow ties for your organization at just $14 per person.  This packages regular value is $1,000!

Example:Custom Bow Tie for Kappa Alpha Psi Hendersonville Alumni Chapter

$1,000 

You will receive one of each necktie & bowtie from the Windsor Platinum Collection and the Walk In Comfort Sock Collection for one year.  You will also get to pick a color selection and name one tie or bow tie design.

Benefiting Others

Job Creation - With growth comes new jobs. We plan to grow Windsor Neckwear to offer 5 salary/hourly office and warehouse positions over the next four years.  Additionally we will have a team of 6 sales reps who travel year round to handle the tradeshow and convention division of the company.  That is a total of 11 jobs that we can create over the next four years. 

Charitable Giving - We donate products to school programs who educate young people their image by teaching young men and women the importance of how they present themselves.  Windsor Neckwear has also donated ties and bow ties to fundraisers to help womens groups and men in transitional living facilites who are seeking employment.

Non-Profit - Windsor Neckwear believes that giving is a responsibilty and a priviledge.  In 2012 we succesfully launched the Ties For Nicole campaign which benefited Nicole Woodley who is currently fighting a successful battle against Breast Cancer.  With our experience doing Ties For Nicole we developed an idea to create a non-profit arm in 2014 which will develop products to be sold in honor of individuals fighting terminal or life threatening illnesses.  60% of  profits from the sales of these items will go to the families they are dedicated to.  The remaining profits will go towards salaries and manufacturing expenses to create more products.  Our plan is to create three additional jobs through our non-profit work over the next five years in different areas of the country. These positions will be created to help us find families that we can help through our 501c3 status.  They will build relationships with medical instutitutions and programs who will help us find qualifying candidates for charitable giving. 

Nicole - Ties for Nicole

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't make a financial contribution here are other ways you can help.

Tweet, Facebook, Instagram the link to our indegogo campaign and tell all of your friends about it.

Send a personal email to 30 of your closest friends and family telling them about our campaign and to check out our page.

Request fliers, send an email to windsorneckwear@gmail.com requesting fliers and we will send you 50 to 100 to handout to people.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

story:
English Version

LOS SUEÑOS NO SIEMPRE SE PERSIGUEN.

A VECES TE PERSIGUEN ELLOS A TI.

Era 2003, era de noche, ¿era fase Rem? cuando se me aparecieron estos zapatos de punta singular y ligeramente descentrada. Es real. Aunque borrosa, era una punta de zapato poderosamente diferente, una punta nunca vista, tan inusual como lógica: era la primera punta que se adaptaba a la forma del pie. La dibujé nada más despertarme. 

Con más ilusión que vértigo un año después me encontré fabricando la primera colección de Laetitia's. La marca funcionó bastante bien. En tres años presentamos cinco colecciones y -las cosas como son- una sexta para Charles Jourdan :-)

Satisfecha con el resultado, en 2007 decidí parar para distanciarme de la marca, recuperar un poco la perspectiva y mejorar cosas pero mi vida dio tal giro que tuve que parar del todo. Hoy, 7 años después, algo me dice que tengo que retomar. Tranquil@, no es ningún rollo espiritual. 

Estoy aquí por una simple pregunta que me ha estado persiguiendo todo este tiempo (¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia´s? ¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia's? ¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia's?) y que me ha llevado, inevitablemente, a hacerme otras preguntas.

Si hay demanda, si se echan de menos, si el tiempo ha demostrado que son atemporales, ¿por qué no intentarlo? Si se volverían a comprar, si hay agua en la piscina, ¿por qué no lanzarme?, ¿por qué no apostar para que lleguen a más pies, a más chicas, a más fiestas? Después de todo, lo más difícil (la horma) ya está hecho.

AL GRANO.

Necesito recaudar 15.000 € para invertirlos en producir 300 pares de Laetitia's en Alicante. 300 no es un número caprichoso, es el pedido mínimo para (volver a) empezar. Por menos de esa cantidad ningún fabricante se pega los dedos. 


AL PLAN.

Relanzar Laetitia's vendiendo 200 pares a un único precio especial, a precio más que amigo hermano, mayorista, reducido (70% menos que el futuro pvp), chollazo, aquí, a quién contribuya (compre un par) en Indiegogo y reservar los otros 100 para venderlos a precio pvp normal en la tienda online que sólo podré lanzar si la suerte y tú me acompañáis. 4 modelos, 7 colores, 2 tacones (6cm y 9cm), y, ¡atención! un modelo especial para novia. El precio, qué precio:





MIRA (LAS MUESTRAS).

Fíjate en la punta: es única, diferente, elegante. No los puedes tocar pero la calidad es extraordinaria.


CATÁLOGO COMPLETO

Para ver más modelos, colores, tacones, pieles, pincha aquí .

 

DENTRO ZOOM.





DENTRO MODELO ESPECIAL NOVIAS :-) 




El adorno es de quita y pon y está fabricado en metal dorado. Se engancha al zapato derecho de manera segura y cómoda, y sirve tanto para la Laetitia´s plana como para las de tacón. Un sueño de zapato de novia, lo dicen las chicas que ya lo han visto, ¡yeah!


¡IMPORTANTE! ¿PAYPAL O VISA?

Cuando elijas el método de pago sólo te dejarán elegir Paypal, acepta como si tuvieras una cuenta porque una vez dentro tendrás la opción de pagar con tarjeta.  


GRACIAS.ZIP

A los que me preguntasteis una y otra vez Cuándo vuelve Laetitia´s, a Indiegogo, al creador del crowdfunding, al inventor de internet, y, por supuesto, a ti por haber leído hasta aquí. 


POR FAVOR.

Contribuye (si te gustan, si te ves) o, simplemente, difunde este proyecto si piensas que le pueden gustar a alguien. 


A LA DUQUESA DE ALBA.

Duquesa, mataría por verla a usted en el ¡Hola! con unas Laetitia's puestas.

 

FAQS

¿Qué pasa si no consigues el dinero? No fabricaré ningún par de zapatos, no te cargarán en cuenta tu aportación, no abriré la tienda online y no me rendiré.

¿Por qué la entrega no es hasta enero? Es el plazo que me ha dado la fábrica. La campaña termina a finales de octubre y tardan 2 meses en fabricarlos, uno a uno.

¿Estilizan tanto el pie como en las fotos? Estilizan tanto el pie como en las fotos.

¿Cuánto me ahorro si las compro durante esta campaña? Alrededor de un 60%, una ganga, una bicoca.

¿Son de piel? Son de piel: de napa, ante y tafilete. La apariencia de piel exótica es un grabado sobre el cuero. Las que brillan son laminadas (oro, azul) y el "glitter" es una tela.

¿La piel cede? No siempre. Pero en el caso de ceder, lo hará sólo de ancho, nunca de largo.

¿Se fabrican en Alicante de verdad? Sí, concretamente en Elda.

¿Puedo donar dinero extra? Cómo negarme.

¿Si conseguido el objetivo no me quedan bien podré devolverlas? Ojalá pudieras, pero sentimos decirte que esto no es una tienda, es una apuesta, no existen las devoluciones. De todas formas si te mides el pie y consultas la guía de tallas de la Galería es muy difícil no acertar.  Si aún así no te van bien siempre puedes regalarlos y alegrarle el día a alguien, subastarlos en ebay o mandárselos a la duquesa.


BREVE GUÍA PARA NO PERDERSE EN EL FASCINANTE MUNDO DE INDIEGOGO.

1. Vas a galería y te miras bien todas las imágenes.

2. Eliges un modelo, te visualizas con él.

3. Vas a recompensas, eliges la tuya y te extrañas de que lo llamen así.

4. Rellenas el proceso de compra (no es obligatorio registrarse, no roba mucho tiempo, no pasa nada si te equivocas en algún paso).

5. Eliges el método de pago ¿Paypal o Visa? Importante: sólo te dejarán elegir Paypal pero una vez dentro tendrás la opción de pagar con tarjeta. 

6. Me visualizas dándote un abrazo.

7. Recibes un email con los detalles de tu compra, lo llaman colaboración. Si tienes alguna pregunta te invitan a enviársela.

8. Y, muy importante, rezas y todos sus sinónimos.

*Te pediremos tu talla de pie vía email. 

**Si quieres pre-comprar más de un par de Laetitia´s tendrás que repetir el proceso, qué le vamos a hacer.



ENGLISH VERSION


YOU DON'T ALWAYS NEED TO CHASE DREAMS: SOMETIMES, THEY CHASE YOU.

It was late one night in 2003 - could it have been while deep in REM?- when I had an apparition of those shoes with a unique, slightly off-centre toe. That's right. Blurred as it may have been, this was a different toe shape, one I had never seen before: at the same time unusual but logical, as was the first toe to adapt itself to the shape of the foot. I committed the design to paper as soon as I awoke  the following day.


More excited than apprehensive, one year later I found myself producing the first collection of Laetitia's. The brand worked well. I presented five collections over the course of three years, and then, well, a sixth for Charles Jourdan.                                     A great stroke of luck that was.

Happy with the results, in 2007 I decided to distance myself for a short while from the brand, to regain perspective and work through any improvements, but life took such a turn that I had to leave it completely behind. Today, seven years on, something tells me it is time to take it up again. Don't worry - I'm not going to get spiritual in anyone. Quite simply, there's just one question that has been nagging me all this time, one that has inevitably led me to ask others in turn:

When will Laetitia's be available again? When will Laetitia's be available again? When will Laetitia's be available again? If the demand is there, if people still miss them, why not give it a go? Why not give it another try? Why not try to give it my all to reach ever more feet, girls, parties? After all, the hard part - the sole - is already done.

TO THE POINT.

I need to raise 15.000€ to produce 300 pairs of Laetitia's in Alicante. 300 is not a random number: it is the minimum order to start (again). You won't find a factory willing to produce any less.

THE PLAN.

To relaunch Laetitia's selling 200 pairs at a special one-off price - mate's rates, wholesale price, reduced price, super bargain price, here, to whoever pre-purchases on Indiegogo, and keep the remaining 100 to sell them at a normal RRP on my online store, which I will only be able to launch if fate, and yourselves, are by my side.



LOOK.





ZOOM IN



ZOOM IN SPECIAL BRIDES MODEL :)



THANKS.

To all of you who ask me time and time again that same question, to indiegogo, to the creator of crowdfunding, to the inventor of internet, and to you for reading as far as this. Thank you.


PLEASE.

Pre-purchase (if you like them, if you think they will suit you) o simply spread the word to someone else who you think may like them. The floor, feet, and our eyes will be eternally grateful to them.


TO HER ROYAL HIGHNESS THE QUEEN.

HRH, I would kill to see you in the pages of HELLO sporting a pair os Laetitia's
story_txt:
English VersionLOS SUEÑOS NO SIEMPRE SE PERSIGUEN.A VECES TE PERSIGUEN ELLOS A TI.
Era 2003,
era de noche, ¿era fase Rem? cuando se me aparecieron estos zapatos de punta
singular y ligeramente descentrada. Es real. Aunque borrosa, era una punta de
zapato poderosamente diferente, una punta nunca vista, tan inusual como lógica: era la primera punta
que se adaptaba a la forma del pie. La dibujé nada más despertarme. Con más
ilusión que vértigo un año después me encontré fabricando la primera colección
de Laetitia's. La marca funcionó bastante bien. En tres años presentamos cinco
colecciones y -las cosas como son- una sexta para Charles Jourdan :-)
Satisfecha
con el resultado, en 2007 decidí parar para distanciarme de la marca, recuperar
un poco la perspectiva y mejorar cosas pero mi vida dio tal giro que tuve que
parar del todo. Hoy, 7 años después, algo me dice que tengo que retomar.
Tranquil@, no es ningún rollo espiritual. Estoy aquí por una simple pregunta que me
ha estado persiguiendo todo este tiempo (¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia´s? ¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia's? ¿Cuándo vuelven las Laetitia's?) y que me ha llevado, inevitablemente, a
hacerme otras preguntas.
Si hay demanda, si se echan de menos, si el tiempo ha demostrado que son atemporales, ¿por qué no intentarlo? Si se volverían a comprar, si hay agua en la piscina, ¿por qué no lanzarme?, ¿por qué no apostar para que lleguen a más pies, a más chicas,
a más fiestas? Después de todo, lo más difícil (la horma) ya está hecho. AL GRANO.Necesito recaudar 15.000 € para invertirlos en producir 300 pares de Laetitia's en Alicante. 300 no es un número caprichoso, es el pedido mínimo para (volver a) empezar. Por menos de esa cantidad ningún fabricante se pega los dedos. AL PLAN.Relanzar Laetitia's vendiendo 200 pares a un único precio especial, a precio más que amigo hermano, mayorista, reducido (70% menos que el futuro pvp), chollazo, aquí, a quién contribuya (compre un par) en Indiegogo y reservar los otros 100 para venderlos a precio pvp normal en la tienda online que sólo podré lanzar si la suerte y tú me acompañáis. 4 modelos, 7 colores, 2 tacones (6cm y 9cm), y, ¡atención! un modelo especial para novia. El precio, qué precio:





MIRA (LAS MUESTRAS).


Fíjate en la punta: es única, diferente, elegante. No los puedes tocar pero la calidad es extraordinaria.


CATÁLOGO COMPLETO
Para ver más modelos, colores, tacones, pieles, pincha aquí .
 
DENTRO ZOOM.














DENTRO MODELO ESPECIAL NOVIAS :-) 









El adorno es de quita y pon y está fabricado en metal dorado. Se engancha al zapato derecho de manera segura y cómoda, y sirve tanto para la Laetitia´s plana como para las de tacón. Un sueño de zapato de novia, lo dicen las chicas que ya lo han visto, ¡yeah!


¡IMPORTANTE! ¿PAYPAL O VISA?Cuando elijas el método de pago sólo te dejarán elegir Paypal, acepta como si tuvieras una cuenta porque una vez dentro tendrás la opción de pagar con tarjeta.  
GRACIAS.ZIP

A los que me preguntasteis una y otra vez Cuándo vuelve Laetitia´s, a Indiegogo, al creador del crowdfunding, al inventor de internet, y, por supuesto, a ti por haber leído hasta aquí. 

POR FAVOR.Contribuye (si te gustan, si te ves) o, simplemente, difunde este proyecto si piensas que le pueden gustar a alguien. 

A LA DUQUESA DE ALBA.Duquesa, mataría por verla a usted en el ¡Hola! con unas Laetitia's puestas.

story:
Why 1st Round energyDNA® will make you better!

COLLECTIONS & SPECIFICATIONS

MEN'S

WOMEN'S

How do you choose your sizes, colors, and styles?
At the end of the campaign (March 26th), we will send you a link to a order page based on your donation package where you can choose your sizes, colors, and styles.

AS SEEN ON:

 

"[energyDNA] will be used to help athletes increase their power, speed, and endurance by incorporating new technologies. Yes, these guys want to do it all."

"...One USC Student's Path To Building The Next Nike."

OUR STORY

1st Round Athletics is an athletic apparel company based in Los Angeles, California. The founders, Teague Egan and Sterling Brewster, are both very passionate, avid sports fans. From Ft. Lauderdale and San Diego respectively, the two met at the University of Southern California. During this time the Trojan football team was in steady decline from being a perennial national championship contender. "We just weren't big enough, not strong enough, not fast enough," explains Sterling. The two put their heads together to try and solve this problem of performance on the field, specifically fatigue.

“We wanted to get into sports apparel, but needed to figure out how to differentiate ourselves from companies like Nike and Under Armour,” said Teague.“They have products that help keep you warm, or cool, get rid of sweat and odor, or even monitor your performance. Well that’s great, but what do athletes really need? Something that actually IMPROVES performance, and makes you BETTER.”

Research was conducted and one of the leading factors causing fatigue is a lack of oxygen to the muscle tissue. “We then found out that there are certain minerals and compounds out there that can capture heat, reflect light, and absorb this infrared energy. These minerals also have an amazing effect on the capillaries do wonders to increase blood flow,” explains Sterling.“I then went to my dad who is a cardiovascular surgeon because he's an expert when it comes to blood flow, science, etc, and he validated the claim.”

With the goal of maximizing this oxygen in the body, and helping player performance, 1st Round Athletics was born.  We then went on to find a 3rd party research lab that had been working on the technology for about 10 years. Focusing on the medical market, specifically diabetics because of the increased blood flow properties our technology possesses, we partnered with them to bring energyDNA® to the athletic market.

WHAT IT IS & HOW IT WORKS


THE PROBLEM: WE'RE ALWAYS LOSING ENERGY.

Over 60% of the energy we consume is lost to escaping body heat. Imagine if turning on the heater in your car burned through more than half of your gasoline. At the low end your body produces approximately 100 watts of energy in a sitting state, that's enough to power a light bulb. At the opposite end of the spectrum, during a full court game of basketball your body burns through over 1,100 watts of energy. To put that into perspective, that's enough energy to power your laptop for 20 hours. 


THE SOLUTION: energyDNA®

Our energyDNA® yarn constructed with Celliant® master batch converts your body heat into reusable energy by reflecting, absorbing, and recycling the energy back to the body increasing oxygen delivery to the muscles. This enables users to fight fatigue and increase performance. 


WHY IT'S THE BEST

EnergyDNA® is the first technology to deliver clinically proven performance benefits to the user.


FEATURES

ATHLETE USE CASES

Right now we only have the capacity to deliver our gear with energyDNA® technology to select athletes from the NFL, NBA, MLB, and Olympic Team USA. These athletes have had the chance to train in it, and the feedback has been amazing. 

Both Jordan Campbell, linebacker for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Shawn Crawford, an Olympic gold medalist sprinter, are fully endorsed by 1st Round. “Every advantage you can get is worth it,” said Crawford. “EnergyDNA® gives me that advantage for me to be the best in the world. It’s apparel that gives back. If you don’t get with the program, you’re going to be left behind.”.

Jordan has been wearing energyDNA® during his offseason training program, "After wearing 1st Round energyDNA® for the past 6 weeks I can't believe how much my performance has increased. I've become stronger, faster, and more explosive."

The company has supplied gear to over 60 other professional athletes, including NFL Pro-Bowlers, NBA All-Stars, #1 Ranked Boxers, and many more.  We need your help to make this amazing technology available to the masses. 

REWARDS

*Please note that we have added and will be adding new rewards such as friends and family, and lifetime discount codes to the actual perks section along the top righthand side throughout the campaign. Those are the official perks.

TOP QUESTIONS

How do I choose my sizes, colors, and styles?
At the end of the campaign (March 26th), we will send you a link to a order page where you can choose your sizes, colors, and styles.

Do you ship internationally? If so, what is the cost?
Yes! EnergyDNA® is worldwide. Please add $25 to your order for international shipping.

When do I get my clothes?
Our manufacturing partners are standing by and excited to start producing our energyDNA® apparel. As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work. We anticipate delivery Summer 2014.

EnergyDNA® IN ACTION





CONNECT WITH US TO RECEIVE UPDATES & SHOW YOUR SUPPORT:

 

https://www.facebook.com/1stRoundAthletics

http://www.instagram.com/energyDNA

http://www.twitter.com/1stround

SUPPORT

Should you have any questions about our reward packages or have any concerns please email our campaign coordinator Sterling Brewster at Sterling@1stround.com. 

WHY INDIEGOGO

Right now we only have the capacity to deliver our energyDNA® gear to select professional athletes. We're launching on Indiegogo because we need YOUR help to bring this technology to the public. The 1st Round campaign will run for 30 days. On this platform you can shop the reward packages made exclusively for Indiegogo and our backers. Every single donation goes towards hitting our $50,000.00 goal. Exclusive benefits, special rewards, and internship opportunities are available as gifts for our loyal community of backers. 

DISTRIBUTORS

We have some amazing donation packages available for larger distributors who are interested in larger, bulk perks. Please email Sterling@1stround.com for more information. 

DETAILED MANUFACTURING PROCESS

We have an amazing manufacturing partner in US Teamwear who specializes in producing our high quality cut and sew garments. Headquartered in Wisconsin, they have fully integrated assembly lines across the US and Asia. With them, we produce the highest quality products, trims, and packaging. Having been in business for over 20 years and manufacturing for major companies like Nike and Reebok, US Teamwear serves as a great partner that also supplies a wealth of industry experience and knowledge.

Our energyDNA® athletic apparel is manufactured at cutting edge facilities across Asia. The yarn is so complex that it requires exclusively specialized machinery to achieve the highest quality of production. We are also utilizing the state of the art seamless machinery. This warp knit seamless manufacturing allows us to delivery exceptional designs precisely fitted to the body, providing a smoother, clean look. 

ABOUT US

A college dorm room start up at USC (Fight On!) we founded 1st Round Athletics with the sole mission of improving athletic performance.  All we want to do is create cutting edge products that will significantly increase athlete's results. The textile industry is rapidly changing and energyDNA® is at the forefront of this revolution. Not only do we aim to change the landscape of the sports industry, but this will also promote health and exercise throughout the world, and hopefully improve people's lifestyle. 

From the beginning we were very well funded. Then when we were able to raise a round of seed funding from outside investors, this was very encouraging for us, and one of the driving forces to continue this venture. We know we have a tremendous product, but we needed people outside the company to confirm our beliefs. Having our investors believe in the technology and product has given us the ability to get to this point. Through all the designing, research, and development, we are finally ready to go into production. 

EnergyDNA® is the future of fiber technology. Under Armour brought moisture wicking technology to the public 18 years ago, Lululemon introduced anti-bacterial fabric 8 years ago, and now 1st Round is raising the bar with energyDNA®, a fabric that increases oxygen level and ultimately your performance.  The world is ready, this is the future!

SCIENCE & ADVISORY BOARD

Our third party technology partner is Hologenix®. Our energyDNA® mineral compound is constructed with patented Celliant® master batch. Our CTO Trenton Horinek is the son of the technology inventor, David Horinek, who first brought it to market in 2008. Initially invented for the medical space to aid those struggling with diabetes and other ailments, we saw there was great value for athletes as well.  We partnered with Trenton and his father in 2011 to help us create our energyDNA® for the athletic market. Hologenix® and the Celliant® technology is backed by a Science Advisory Board comprised of doctors and professors from top universities across the country. Please see below.


CLINICAL STUDIES


 SIZING CHART

THE QUESTIONS 

Disclaimer: Please note that our third party technology partner is Hologenix, LLC. They manufacture energyDNA® for us using Celliant® master batch.

Q: What is energyDNA®?

A: EnergyDNA® is constructed with Celliant® that can be knit or woven into fabrics to enhance oxygen flow to muscles. It is the world's first responsive textile with clinically proven benefits to the human body.

Q: What is a responsive textile?

A: A responsive textile is a material that has positive effects when worn or kept in close proximity to the body. 

Q: How was energyDNA® developed and why? 

A: The research that led to the creation of the Celliant® compound used in energyDNA® began in the 1990s, when a team of pioneers in the field of alternative medicine visited Asia and observed the use of several natural substances that were thoughts to have a positive effect on the body. After seven years and several more of clinical testing, the team was able to integrate these materials into yarn.

Q: How does it work? 

A: The Celliant® in energyDNA® absorbs and stores the electromagnetic (energy) emissions from the human body and releases them where they are reabsorbed into the skin and deep muscle tissue.  In the deep muscle tissue they act as catalysts for natural, biological processes resulting in enhanced oxygen levels and more balanced body temperature during physical activity. 

Q: How do you know it is working? 

A: While you will not necessarily be able to perceive or feel an increase in circulation, oxygenation or blood flow, in clinical testing we have measured the increase in skin oxygen levels (TCPO2) and consistently recorded significant improvements across a wide spectrum of test subjects. 

Q: What ingredients are producing the effects? 

A: EnergyDNA® is specially formulated with proprietary ingredients that are blended with polyester fiber. This fiber, in turn, can be woven or knit into almost any materials including wools, cottons and other polyesters. While the exact formula is a patent protected trade secret, we can say that energyDNA® contains many minerals including Titanium Dioxide, Silicon Dioxide and Aluminum Oxide. 

Q: Can energyDNA® cause a rash or other skin abrasions? 

A: While it is possible to have an allergic reaction to any material, energyDNA® contains minerals that most people come into contact with on a regular basis. Of the athletes using our clothing the past six months there have not been any reported cases of allergic reactions to energyDNA®.

Q: How long do I need to use the products to get the positive effects? 

A: EnergyDNA® starts to work immediately and the effects generally increase the longer they are used. All products are tested over at least a 90‐minute period to ensure that they are effective. 

Q: Do energyDNA® products need special laundering? 

A: No. Because energyDNA® is embedded in the fabric, it cannot wash out or wear out, and the benefits of energyDNA® will not decrease after laundering. Generally, energyDNA® products can be machine‐washed and dried.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

Production 
Due to the technical quality of our fabric and complexity of the designs, production will require 3 months from the end of this project. This is the reason for the Summer 2014 delivery date. 

Fulfilment 
We are experienced in dealing with the challenges associated with manufacturing and we're working with highly reputable factories and suppliers to ensure that all rewards are shipped on time. We have already scheduled our place in production with our manufacturers and they are eager to start. If a high volume of orders or unforeseen circumstances arise that could cause delays, I will communicate directly with all my backers and work to fix the problem. It’s very important to us that our customers are happy and satisfied!

Exchange Policy 
If you're not satisfied with your clothing purchase you will be able to return and exchange it for a different size. If your preferred size is unavailable, we will work with you to ensure you get the piece you love!

To put that into perspective, that's enough energy to power your laptop for 20 hours. THE SOLUTION: energyDNA®Our energyDNA® yarn constructed with Celliant® master batch converts your body heat into reusable energy by reflecting, absorbing, and recycling the energy back to the body increasing oxygen delivery to the muscles. This enables users to fight fatigue and increase performance. WHY IT'S THE BESTEnergyDNA® is the first technology to deliver clinically proven performance benefits to the user.FEATURESATHLETE USE CASESRight now we only have the capacity to deliver our gear with energyDNA® technology to select athletes from the NFL, NBA, MLB, and Olympic Team USA. These athletes have had the chance to train in it, and the feedback has been amazing. Both Jordan Campbell, linebacker for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Shawn Crawford, an Olympic gold medalist sprinter, are fully endorsed by 1st Round. “Every advantage you can get is worth it,” said Crawford. “EnergyDNA® gives me that advantage for me to be the best in the world. It’s apparel that gives back. If you don’t get with the program, you’re going to be left behind.”.Jordan has been wearing energyDNA® during his offseason training program, "After wearing 1st Round energyDNA® for the past 6 weeks I can't believe how much my performance has increased. I've become stronger, faster, and more explosive."The company has supplied gear to over 60 other professional athletes, including NFL Pro-Bowlers, NBA All-Stars, #1 Ranked Boxers, and many more.  We need your help to make this amazing technology available to the masses. REWARDS*Please note that we have added and will be adding new rewards such as friends and family, and lifetime discount codes to the actual perks section along the top righthand side throughout the campaign. Those are the official perks.TOP QUESTIONSHow do I choose my sizes, colors, and styles?At the end of the campaign (March 26th), we will send you a link to a order page where you can choose your sizes, colors, and styles.Do you ship internationally? If so, what is the cost?Yes! EnergyDNA® is worldwide. Please add $25 to your order for international shipping.When do I get my clothes?Our manufacturing partners are standing by and excited to start producing our energyDNA® apparel. As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work. We anticipate delivery Summer 2014.EnergyDNA® IN ACTIONCONNECT WITH US TO RECEIVE UPDATES & SHOW YOUR SUPPORT: https://www.facebook.com/1stRoundAthleticshttp://www.instagram.com/energyDNAhttp://www.twitter.com/1stroundSUPPORTShould you have any questions about our reward packages or have any concerns please email our campaign coordinator Sterling Brewster at Sterling@1stround.com. WHY INDIEGOGORight now we only have the capacity to deliver our energyDNA® gear to select professional athletes. We're launching on Indiegogo because we need YOUR help to bring this technology to the public. The 1st Round campaign will run for 30 days. On this platform you can shop the reward packages made exclusively for Indiegogo and our backers. Every single donation goes towards hitting our $50,000.00 goal. Exclusive benefits, special rewards, and internship opportunities are available as gifts for our loyal community of backers. DISTRIBUTORSWe have some amazing donation packages available for larger distributors who are interested in larger, bulk perks. Please email Sterling@1stround.com for more information. DETAILED MANUFACTURING PROCESSWe have an amazing manufacturing partner in US Teamwear who specializes in producing our high quality cut and sew garments. Headquartered in Wisconsin, they have fully integrated assembly lines across the US and Asia. With them, we produce the highest quality products, trims, and packaging. Having been in business for over 20 years and manufacturing for major companies like Nike and Reebok, US Teamwear serves as a great partner that also supplies a wealth of industry experience and knowledge.Our energyDNA® athletic apparel is manufactured at cutting edge facilities across Asia. The yarn is so complex that it requires exclusively specialized machinery to achieve the highest quality of production. We are also utilizing the state of the art seamless machinery. This warp knit seamless manufacturing allows us to delivery exceptional designs precisely fitted to the body, providing a smoother, clean look. ABOUT USA college dorm room start up at USC (Fight On!) we founded 1st Round Athletics with the sole mission of improving athletic performance.  All we want to do is create cutting edge products that will significantly increase athlete's results. The textile industry is rapidly changing and energyDNA® is at the forefront of this revolution. Not only do we aim to change the landscape of the sports industry, but this will also promote health and exercise throughout the world, and hopefully improve people's lifestyle. From the beginning we were very well funded. Then when we were able to raise a round of seed funding from outside investors, this was very encouraging for us, and one of the driving forces to continue this venture. We know we have a tremendous product, but we needed people outside the company to confirm our beliefs. Having our investors believe in the technology and product has given us the ability to get to this point. Through all the designing, research, and development, we are finally ready to go into production. EnergyDNA® is the future of fiber technology. Under Armour brought moisture wicking technology to the public 18 years ago, Lululemon introduced anti-bacterial fabric 8 years ago, and now 1st Round is raising the bar with energyDNA®, a fabric that increases oxygen level and ultimately your performance.  The world is ready, this is the future!SCIENCE & ADVISORY BOARDOur third party technology partner is Hologenix®. Our energyDNA® mineral compound is constructed with patented Celliant® master batch. Our CTO Trenton Horinek is the son of the technology inventor, David Horinek, who first brought it to market in 2008. Initially invented for the medical space to aid those struggling with diabetes and other ailments, we saw there was great value for athletes as well.  We partnered with Trenton and his father in 2011 to help us create our energyDNA® for the athletic market. Hologenix® and the Celliant® technology is backed by a Science Advisory Board comprised of doctors and professors from top universities across the country. Please see below.CLINICAL STUDIES SIZING CHARTTHE QUESTIONS Disclaimer: Please note that our third party technology partner is Hologenix, LLC. They manufacture energyDNA® for us using Celliant® master batch.Q: What is energyDNA®?A: EnergyDNA® is constructed with Celliant® that can be knit or woven into fabrics to enhance oxygen flow to muscles. It is the world's first responsive textile with clinically proven benefits to the human body.Q: What is a responsive textile?A: A responsive textile is a material that has positive effects when worn or kept in close proximity to the body. Q: How was energyDNA® developed and why? A: The research that led to the creation of the Celliant® compound used in energyDNA® began in the 1990s, when a team of pioneers in the field of alternative medicine visited Asia and observed the use of several natural substances that were thoughts to have a positive effect on the body. After seven years and several more of clinical testing, the team was able to integrate these materials into yarn.Q: How does it work? A: The Celliant® in energyDNA® absorbs and stores the electromagnetic (energy) emissions from the human body and releases them where they are reabsorbed into the skin and deep muscle tissue.  In the deep muscle tissue they act as catalysts for natural, biological processes resulting in enhanced oxygen levels and more balanced body temperature during physical activity. Q: How do you know it is working? A: While you will not necessarily be able to perceive or feel an increase in circulation, oxygenation or blood flow, in clinical testing we have measured the increase in skin oxygen levels (TCPO2) and consistently recorded significant improvements across a wide spectrum of test subjects. Q: What ingredients are producing the effects? A: EnergyDNA® is specially formulated with proprietary ingredients that are blended with polyester fiber. This fiber, in turn, can be woven or knit into almost any materials including wools, cottons and other polyesters. While the exact formula is a patent protected trade secret, we can say that energyDNA® contains many minerals including Titanium Dioxide, Silicon Dioxide and Aluminum Oxide. Q: Can energyDNA® cause a rash or other skin abrasions? A: While it is possible to have an allergic reaction to any material, energyDNA® contains minerals that most people come into contact with on a regular basis. Of the athletes using our clothing the past six months there have not been any reported cases of allergic reactions to energyDNA®.Q: How long do I need to use the products to get the positive effects? A: EnergyDNA® starts to work immediately and the effects generally increase the longer they are used. All products are tested over at least a 90‐minute period to ensure that they are effective. Q: Do energyDNA® products need special laundering? A: No. Because energyDNA® is embedded in the fabric, it cannot wash out or wear out, and the benefits of energyDNA® will not decrease after laundering. Generally, energyDNA® products can be machine‐washed and dried.RISKS AND CHALLENGES Production Due to the technical quality of our fabric and complexity of the designs, production will require 3 months from the end of this project. This is the reason for the Summer 2014 delivery date. Fulfilment We are experienced in dealing with the challenges associated with manufacturing and we're working with highly reputable factories and suppliers to ensure that all rewards are shipped on time. We have already scheduled our place in production with our manufacturers and they are eager to start. If a high volume of orders or unforeseen circumstances arise that could cause delays, I will communicate directly with all my backers and work to fix the problem. It’s very important to us that our customers are happy and satisfied!Exchange Policy If you're not satisfied with your clothing purchase you will be able to return and exchange it for a different size. If your preferred size is unavailable, we will work with you to ensure you get the piece you love!

story:
My Goal

I design one of a kind, rustic, bohemian wedding gowns and am seeking funds to manufacture and wholesale them.

I was just starting to establish my brand when I was laid off from Abercrombie, and am struggling to continue to develop and grow my brand. 

My goal is to take the wedding gown line I have designed and manufacture and wholesale it to boutiques. 

I believe my designs are one of a kind and have a unique place in the bridal market. I want to combine my knowledge and experience in the industry and utilize them to create a luxurious line of wedding gowns that offer brides a chance to feel special and unique. 

I will design and manufacture the line using a manufacturer that I know and trust, so I can personally oversee the process and ensure I am delivering the best quality gowns. 

With your help we can make Cierra Lauren a brand all brides love. 

Thank you so much for your support! 

About the Designer

Cierra is native to Columbus, Ohio and graduated from Columbus College of Art and Design with a degree in Fashion Design. Her experience in the global fashion industry has expanded her knowledge and connections. She has worked for leading brands such as Abercrombie and Fitch. She has participated in many runway shows and has had her designs displayed. One of her designs was featured at the grammy awards this past year. With exquisite attention to detail her aesthetic is couture and avant-garde. Her world traveling is apparent in her exotically chic designs, which sets her apart from other designers.

The Need

Every little bit helps me achieve my goals. The main goal is to manufacture and sell a couture wholesale line of wedding gowns. It takes a lot to get to that stage and there are a lot of little costs along the way. I believe that God is leading the way and with all of your support that we can make a difference. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any little bit helps :) You can just give $1 or spread the word on social media will help others know what I am trying to achieve and will help everyone get excited about my brand! 

Thanks so much for your support! 

Ways to Connect With Me

Linked In: http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=69519201

Etsy Shop: https://www.etsy.com/shop/CierraLaurenDesigns

Website: http://cierralauren.wix.com/cierralauren

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cierralaurendesigns
